Title: Junior ML Scientist | IS Team (Job Ref.: AICOS_Jobs_2025_14) | Porto, Portugal
HTML:
Job Title: Junior ML Scientist

Job Ref: AICOS_Jobs_2025_14

Job Type: Full-time contract.

Job Location: Porto, Portugal.

Job Description And Responsibilities

Fraunhofer Portugal AICOSis seeking a talented Junior ML Scientist to join our dynamic and multidisciplinary team within the Intelligent Systems group. In this role, you will be at the forefront of technological innovation, working on applied research projects that bridge the gap between cutting-edge research and real-world impact. You will contribute to initiatives that enhance industries, promote social well-being, and improve quality of life.

Your Role

Develop advanced anomaly detection and forecasting modules to analyse financial time series, identify risks and provide strategic insights based on historical data trends.

Your Profile

Academic Qualifications:

  • Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent qualifications in Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Data science, Artificial Intelligence or related studies.

Technical Skills

  • Programming proficiency in Python and experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., Sklearn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch);
  • Interest in creating machine learning models from time series.

Other Skills

  • Excellent English communication skills (technical and general audiences);
  • Capacity to translate research findings into actionable insights for real-world applications.

We Value

  • Familiarity with machine learning for tabular data and time series;
  • Experience or interest in forecasting;
  • Interest in applied research in AI and ML;
  • Ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary and cross-functional teams;
  • Autonomous, dependable, proactive, and a critical-thinking team player.

Why Should You Join Fraunhofer Portugal

  • Innovative Environment: Be part of a people-centric workplace that fosters creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. We encourage the development of new ideas and ensure that every voice is heard;
  • Research with Impact: Engage in projects that sit at the intersection of research and real-world applications, contributing to technology that makes a tangible difference in society;
  • Multidisciplinary Teams: Collaborate with professionals from diverse backgrounds, enhancing your learning and professional growth;
  • Professional Excellence: Work within a culture that upholds professional standards and best practices, promoting continuous improvement and excellence in research;
  • Flexible Work Arrangements: Benefit from flexible working hours and opportunities to work from home, supporting a healthy work-life balance;
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Benefit from a partially funded health insurance plan, and a variety of additional perks;
  • Supportive Culture: Join a team with an excellent spirit, where collaboration, mutual support, and team achievements are celebrated.

Application Process

Applications are permanently open until the ideal candidate is selected. The first evaluation of applications will occur on 28th of July 2025.

The selected candidate is expected to start working in September 2025.

To Apply

Send your application to jobs@fraunhofer.pt including:

  • Curriculum Vitae (mandatory);
  • Motivation Letter;
  • Recommendation Letters (optional but welcome).

Note

The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of the following projects:

  • FIBFlow ‚Äì Financial Intelligent Business Flow, with Notice No. MPr-2023-08-SIID-ID (Projetos em Copromo√ß√£o).

Title: Junior MLOps Scientist | IS Team (Job Ref.: AICOS_Jobs_2025_19) | Porto, Portugal
HTML:
Job Title: Junior MLOps Scientist

Job Ref: AICOS_Jobs_2025_19

Job Type: Full-time contract.

Job Location: Porto, Portugal.

Job Description And Responsibilities

Fraunhofer Portugal AICOSis seeking a talented Junior MLOps Scientist to join our dynamic and multidisciplinary team within the Intelligent Systems group. vIn this role, you will be at the forefront of technological innovation, working on applied research projects that bridge the gap between cutting-edge research and real-world impact. You will contribute to initiatives that enhance industries, promote social well-being, and improve quality of life. Specifically, you will contribute to the research and development of MLOps infrastructure and deployment best practices for robust ML applications.

Your Role

  • Explore the usage of a data governance tool (e.g. DataHub, OpenMetadata) for monitoring active datasets and AI models under test, during groundbreaking workflows of AI-based screening, in healthcare image data;
  • Develop flexible and robust APIs over toolkits aimed for Trustworthy AI add-ons to ML pipeline (e.g. bias, explainability, robustness tests, etc.);
  • Deploy the platform across diverse environments, from cloud infrastructures (e.g., AWS, Azure) to edge devices (e.g., NVIDIA Jetson);
  • Collaboration and Maintenance:

> Work closely with multidisciplinary teams to integrate data governance and deployment best practices into existing pipelines and platforms;

> Maintain and refine current codebases, adhering to best practices in software development and reproducible research;

> Contribute to strategic discussions on advancing research directions, staying updated on cutting-edge MLOps frameworks and methodologies.

Your Profile

Academic Qualifications:

  • Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent qualifications in Biomedical Engineering, Computer Science and Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering, or related studies.

Technical Skills

  • Software development best practices, Git, Docker containerization, [DVC is a plus];
  • Programming proficiency in Python and experience with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow;
  • Experience with API design and implementation, as well as deployment in different environments (on-prem, cloud, edge).

Other Skills

  • Excellent English communication skills (technical and general audiences);
  • Capacity to translate research findings into actionable insights for real-world applications.

We Value

  • Familiarity with MLOps practices and frameworks, including data governance and model registry tools;
  • Experience or interest in deploying robust ML solutions in diverse environments, from edge devices, to local or cloud servers;
  • Commitment to follow best practices for software development, and to document and share the implemented procedures with the remaining team;
  • Ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary and cross-functional teams;
  • Autonomous, dependable, proactive, and a critical-thinking team player.

Why Should You Join Fraunhofer Portugal

  • Innovative Environment: Be part of a people-centric workplace that fosters creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. We encourage the development of new ideas and ensure that every voice is heard;
  • Research with Impact: Engage in projects that sit at the intersection of research and real-world applications, contributing to technology that makes a tangible difference in society;
  • Multidisciplinary Teams: Collaborate with professionals from diverse backgrounds, enhancing your learning and professional growth;
  • Professional Excellence: Work within a culture that upholds professional standards and best practices, promoting continuous improvement and excellence in research;
  • Flexible Work Arrangements: Benefit from flexible working hours and opportunities to work from home, supporting a healthy work-life balance;
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Benefit from a partially funded health insurance plan, and a variety of additional perks;
  • Supportive Culture: Join a team with an excellent spirit, where collaboration, mutual support, and team achievements are celebrated.

Application Process

Applications are permanently open until the ideal candidate is selected. The first evaluation of applications will occur on 28th of July 2025.

The selected candidate is expected to start working in September 2025.

To Apply

Send your application to jobs@fraunhofer.pt including:

  • Curriculum Vitae (mandatory);
  • Motivation Letter;
  • Recommendation Letters (optional but welcome).

Note

The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of the following projects:

  • ACHILLES ‚Äì Human-centred Machine Learning: Lighter, Clearer, Safer, with Notice No. HORIZON-CL4-2024-DATA-01-01 and Project Reference No. 101189689;
  • AICeBlock ‚Äì Artificial Intelligence Certification through the Blockchain, with Notice No. HORIZON-CL4-2021-DATA-01-01 and Project Reference No. 101070225.

Title: Data Science Trainee
Description:
Sword Health is on a mission to free two billion people from pain.

With 67% of members achieving a pain-free life and a 70% reduction in surgery intent, at Sword, we are using AI Care to change lives, and save millions for our 25,000+ enterprise clients across three continents. Today, we hold the majority of industry patents, win 70% of competitive evaluations, and have raised more than $300 million from top venture firms like Founders Fund, Sapphire Ventures, General Catalyst, and Khosla Ventures.

Recognized as a Forbes Best Startup Employer in 2025, this award highlights our focus on being a destination for the best and brightest talent. Not only have we experienced unprecedented growth since our market debut in 2020, but we‚Äôve also created a remarkable mission and value-driven environment that is loved by our growing team. With a recent valuation of $4 billion, we are in a phase of hyper growth and expansion, and we‚Äôre looking for individuals with passion, commitment, and energy to help us scale our global impact.

Joining Sword means committing to a set of core values, chief amongst them to ‚Äúdo it for the patients‚Äù every day, and to always ‚Äúdeliver more than expected‚Äù on behalf of our members and clients.

This is an opportunity for you to make a significant difference on a massive scale as you work alongside 1000+ (and growing!) talented colleagues, spanning three continents. Your charge? To help us build a pain-free world, powered by AI, enhanced by people ‚Äî accessible to all.

The Sword Trainee Program is not about playing it safe, it‚Äôs where your career meets real-world impact. Over 12 months, you‚Äôll be part of a global team using technology to solve human problems at scale, and you‚Äôll do meaningful work from day one. You‚Äôll build and question, and be pushed to think deeper and move faster. Here, you won‚Äôt just apply what you learned in school ‚Äî you‚Äôll stretch it, test it, and turn it into solutions. If you‚Äôre looking for purpose, ownership, and a steep learning curve, this is your launchpad. And if you're ready to turn your potential into something that matters, we‚Äôre ready for you.

Sword Health is looking for a Data Scientist Trainee to help enable DS/ML projects to power the Sword health platform from end-to-end. You will work together on multiple vertical projects such as Product, Marketing, Finance and Clinical Research to design, prototype and test novel clinical and digital models. Additionally, you will dig deep in data statistical analysis that will help both business and patient care.

You will be working inside our Data Team at Sword that is helping our business to become more and more Data centric and you will have a tremendous impact on millions of lives in need of care.

You‚Äôll collaborate closely with Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Data Analysts where you‚Äôll help enable AI/ML projects to power the Sword health platform from end-to-end.

What you‚Äôll be doing:


Contribute to data science projects from design, exploration, prototype and production implementation;
Test novel clinical and digital interventions to understand our patient health needs, their behavioral tendencies and how to improve patient recovery;
Leverage advanced programming and processing of large datasets;
Work alongside with data scientists, data engineers and data analysts in complex analysis and in deploying designed and well-tested ML models into practice, helping to build appropriate frameworks to test and monitor ongoing model performance:
Provide methodological, statistical, design and analytical feedback for new and ongoing operations / applied research projects;
Work and collaborate with stakeholders (Finance, Marketing, Product, Clinical operations) to develop strategies and data science products to solve real world problems



What you need to have:


Previous Experience using machine learning to derive insights and find patterns in the data;
Knowledge of SQL as well as statistical packages (such as those in Python);
Focus and dedication to solve complex business problems with data, being able to use Data Science technical tools and techniques.



What we would love to see:


Genuine curiosity that drives you to experiment and try new things



To ensure you feel good solving a big Human problem, we offer:


A stimulating, fast-paced environment with lots of room for creativity;
A start of a bright future at a promising high-tech startup company;
Access to our health and well-being program (digital therapist sessions);
Learning opportunities with tailored mentoring
Remote or Hybrid work policy.
To get to know more about our Tech Stack, check here
Please note that this position does not offer relocation assistance. Candidates must possess a valid EU visa and be based in Portugal

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Purpose


Analyse and interpret US healthcare claims and insurance plan-level data using SQL and Python to assess prescription patterns, patient treatment journey, prescriber landscape, insurance coverage across the competitor landscape, as well as possible unmet need and market size.
Provide strategic insights and inform the commercialization and go-to-market strategy for MoonLake.
Setup and operate analytics infrastructure for MoonLake Commercial across several data sources and platforms.
Drive additional data and insights related cross-functional projects, such as scientific papers.
Conduct detailed analysis using secondary real world data sources, including claims or EHR. Ideally familiar with US private and public drug and medical procedure claims data.
Good knowledge of statistics.
Support development of other study documents including protocols, analysis specifications, and study reports.
Ability to create and caracterize patient population, build patient cohorts, and define and validate key variables specific to business questions. Conduct detailed analyses of patient cohorts and QC datasets within time and ensure quality standards for a variety of studies.
Manage and contribute to quality control of programs and automation of data refreshes.
Communicate timelines, progress reports, and results to key stakeholders.
Ability to create dashboards preferred but not essential (PowerBI).


Your profile

Major Accountabilities


Leverage SQL and Python for efficient data extraction, manipulation, and interpretation for patient claims and plan-level insurance data, e.g.:
Conduct in-depth analysis of patient lifetime treatment journey.
Evaluate healthcare practitioner activity across the market.
Analyse US healthcare claims data to evaluate market presence and trends among competitors.
Analyse healthcare insurance plan-level data to assess prescription market coverage.
Merge and harmonize multiple data sources for advanced analytics.
Identify gaps and opportunities in competitor insurance coverage and market positioning.
Ensure data quality and integrity during analysis to support accurate reporting.
Document all processes, experiments, data sources and analyses to ensure a robust and reproducible infrastructure.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver actionable insights on market trends.
Provide strategic recommendations based on data analysis to inform business decisions.
Create and maintain dashboards or reports to monitor key metrics and market performance, as well as visualize advanced analytics outcomes.

Job Requirements

Education: Masters in Biomedical Engineering, Biostatistics, Data Science, Computer Science or related field with 2-5 years relevant experience or PhD with 1 years of relevant experience required.

Skills/knowledge/behavioural competencies: SQL, Python, Pandas, SkLearn, NLP, Power BI, Git, Data Visualization.

Qualifications


Knowledge of statistics, programming, and real-world studies
Prior programming experience using medical health records, RWD or claims data is a bonus.
Intermediate knowledge of SQL, Python or R acceptable.
Good organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills
Ability to effectively manage and prioritize multiple tasks and projects.
Excellent accuracy and attention to detail.


Why us?

An exciting job opportunity awaits you!

MoonLake is a dynamic and innovative company pushing the boundaries of possibility, and we are looking for passionate individuals to join our stellar team.

What We Offer

Learning Environment: An opportunity to learn and grow alongside experienced professionals in a supportive and innovative biotech environment.

Impactful Work: Contribute to ground-breaking projects that have the potential to transform global healthcare.

Flexibility and Balance: Work remotely/hybrid, enjoying a healthy work-life balance while making meaningful contributions to our team.

Career Growth: A clear path for career progression, with the chance to take on more responsibilities as you develop your skills.

About Us

MoonLake Immunotherapeutics is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company unlocking the potential of sonelokimab, a novel investigational Nanobody¬Æ for the treatment of the inflammatory disease, to revolutionize outcomes for patients.

We continue to make significant progress in our Global Clinical Development Programs. The company‚Äôs focus is on inflammatory diseases with a major unmet need, including hidradenitis suppurativa and psoriatic arthritis ‚Äì conditions affecting millions of people worldwide with a large need for improved treatment options. MoonLake was founded in 2021 and is headquarted in Zug, with hubs in Cambridge & Porto.

Further information is available at www.moonlaketx.com

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
Who We Are




Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.




We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.




What We Offer




A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.




What you will do




Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.




What you‚Äôll bring




1‚Äì2 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role (internships included).
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English (written and spoken)




Nice to have:




Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).
Participation in academic or personal analytics projects.




In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: ML Engineer (Portugal Based Remote/Hybrid)
HTML:
Sword Health is on a mission to free two billion people from pain.

With 67% of members achieving a pain-free life and a 70% reduction in surgery intent, at Sword, we are using AI Care to change lives, and save millions for our 25,000+ enterprise clients across three continents. Today, we hold the majority of industry patents, win 70% of competitive evaluations, and have raised more than $300 million from top venture firms like Founders Fund, Sapphire Ventures, General Catalyst, and Khosla Ventures.

Recognized as a Forbes Best Startup Employer in 2025, this award highlights our focus on being a destination for the best and brightest talent. Not only have we experienced unprecedented growth since our market debut in 2020, but we‚Äôve also created a remarkable mission and value-driven environment that is loved by our growing team. With a recent valuation of $4 billion, we are in a phase of hyper growth and expansion, and we‚Äôre looking for individuals with passion, commitment, and energy to help us scale our global impact.

Joining Sword means committing to a set of core values, chief amongst them to ‚Äúdo it for the patients‚Äù every day, and to always ‚Äúdeliver more than expected‚Äù on behalf of our members and clients.

This is an opportunity for you to make a significant difference on a massive scale as you work alongside 1000+ (and growing!) talented colleagues, spanning three continents. Your charge? To help us build a pain-free world, powered by AI, enhanced by people ‚Äî accessible to all.

The AI Team

The main goal of the AI Team is to leverage AI and ML to provide high-quality clinical care at unprecedented levels of personalization and scale. In this regard, in close collaboration with the clinical team, we develop ML-powered features that identify the best course of action for each patient at any given moment or circumstance whilst employing a holistic perspective but also contemplating any relevant nuance. We also work on ensuring the overall experience is as close as possible to a 1:1 session with a Physical Therapist and thus play a crucial role in enabling the AI Care provided by Sword.

Examples of this are projects like ‚ÄúPhoenix‚Äù and all the decision support systems that empower our Physical Therapists to provide world-class care to our members

As for the near future, our focus will be on taking the degree of personalization and human touch of our AI care to a whole new level by leveraging the most recent developments in the Generative AI field.

What you'll be doing:

  • Contribute to designing, building, evaluating, shipping, and improving Sword‚Äôs products through hands-on AI/ML development;
  • Develop and maintain data processing pipelines for getting the data required to build and evaluate models;
  • Work alongside the Product, Data & Engineering Teams to define and implement AI/ML-powered features for internal and external users;
  • Share your knowledge and experience of how to build ML systems


What you need to have:

  • 2+ years of professional experience in Machine Learning;
  • Hands-on experience implementing and maintaining machine learning systems;
  • Solid experience in SQL and Python as well as experience developing production software;
  • Working knowledge of Python data stack (numpy, pandas, matplotlib, scikit-learn, etc);
  • Ability to learn quickly and dive deep into new problems and fields;
  • Ability to communicate concepts clearly and interface with both technical and non-technical stakeholders;
  • Ability to prioritize and solve issues according to the team‚Äôs direction and goals


What we would love to see:

  • Experience working in a fast-paced environment and wearing different hats;
  • Experience building data processing pipelines;
  • Experience using cloud platforms like GCP or AWS


To ensure you feel good solving a big Human problem, we offer:

  • A stimulating, fast-paced environment with lots of room for creativity;
  • A bright future at a promising high-tech startup company;
  • Career development and growth, with a competitive salary;
  • The opportunity to work with a talented team and to add real value to an innovative solution with the potential to change the future of healthcare;
  • A stimulating environment with room for creativity;
  • A flexible environment where you can control your hours (remotely) with unlimited vacation;
  • Access to our health and well-being program (digital therapist sessions);
  • Remote or Hybrid work policy


The interview process:

  • 30-minute call with the recruiter;
  • 30-minute call with an initial screener;
  • 1 take-home assignment (to be delivered within 1 week);
  • 1h general skills and working principles interview;
  • 1h mindset and cultural fit interview


Portugal - Sword Benefits & Perks:

  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Meal allowance
  • Equity shares
  • Remote work allowance
  • Flexible working hours
  • Work from home
  • Discretionary vacation
  • Snacks and beverages
  • English class


Note: Please note that this position does not offer relocation assistance. Candidates must possess a valid EU visa and be based in Portugal.

Sword Health, which includes SWORD Health, Inc. and Sword Health Professionals (consisting of Sword Health Care Providers, P.A., SWORD Health Care Providers of NJ, P.C., SWORD Health Care Physical Therapy Providers of CA, P.C.*) complies with applicable Federal and State civil rights laws and does not discriminate on the basis of Age, Ancestry, Color, Citizenship, Gender, Gender expression, Gender identity, Gender information, Marital status, Medical condition, National origin, Physical or mental disability, Pregnancy, Race, Religion, Caste, Sexual orientation, and Veteran status.

This range includes base, variable and equity.

These compensation bands are just the starting point. Once someone joins and proves they‚Äôre outlier talent, we adjust quickly to ensure their compensation aligns with their impact.

Our job titles may span more than one career level. Actual pay is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, location, market demand, and other factors. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base salary and any potential variable, bonus or sales incentives, and the Company‚Äôs estimation of the value of private company stock options, if applicable. The pay range is subject to change, future value of company stock options is not guaranteed, and compensation may be modified in the future. In addition to our total compensation, Sword offers a number of benefits as listed below.

Title: Data Scientist (H√≠brido @ Porto)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: DATA ENGINEER

Seniority: Minimum 4-5 years

Type of position: Hybrid (in Porto, Portugal)




The amazing you, will have:

At least 4 years of experience as a Data Scientist.
Strong foundation in statistics, probability, and predictive modeling.
Hands-on experience with Python (pandas, scikit-learn, NumPy, matplotlib, seaborn).
Experience building, validating, and deploying machine learning models (supervised and unsupervised).
Ability to handle large datasets, perform EDA, and apply feature engineering.
Solid SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience using Jupyter Notebooks or similar tools for prototyping and sharing insights.
Understanding of model evaluation metrics (e.g., precision, recall, AUC).
Fluent English (spoken and written) ‚Äì for effective communication with technical teams.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, AWS, Azure).
Familiarity with ML Ops tools (e.g., MLflow, SageMaker, Vertex AI).
Background in Deep Learning (e.g., TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch).
Basic understanding of ETL processes and data pipelines.
Experience in NLP, computer vision, or time series forecasting projects.




To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

Related certifications.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Innovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Show more
HTML:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!


We are looking for an Amazing: DATA ENGINEER

Seniority: Minimum 4-5 years

Type of position: Hybrid (in Porto, Portugal)


The amazing you, will have:

  • At least 4 years of experience as a Data Scientist.
  • Strong foundation in statistics, probability, and predictive modeling.
  • Hands-on experience with Python (pandas, scikit-learn, NumPy, matplotlib, seaborn).
  • Experience building, validating, and deploying machine learning models (supervised and unsupervised).
  • Ability to handle large datasets, perform EDA, and apply feature engineering.
  • Solid SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
  • Experience using Jupyter Notebooks or similar tools for prototyping and sharing insights.
  • Understanding of model evaluation metrics (e.g., precision, recall, AUC).
  • Fluent English (spoken and written) ‚Äì for effective communication with technical teams.
  • Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, AWS, Azure).
  • Familiarity with ML Ops tools (e.g., MLflow, SageMaker, Vertex AI).
  • Background in Deep Learning (e.g., TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch).
  • Basic understanding of ETL processes and data pipelines.
  • Experience in NLP, computer vision, or time series forecasting projects.


To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

  • Related certifications.


Why should you become part of our family?

  • You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
  • Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
  • Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
  • International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
  • Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
  • In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
  • Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
  • Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
  • Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Innovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Linde Portugal, LDA

Data Scientist (m/f/d)

Porto or Lisboa, Portugal, Barcelona, Spain | req22905

What You Will Enjoy Doing


You will generate value out of data by identification, driving and implementing use cases in the area of analytics across all value streams/ regions/functions
Furthermore, you will provide profound business understanding combined with a strong skillset of advanced data engineering and data science to transform business questions into data driven insight in language such as SQL, R, Python etc
Together with the data science lead drive the concept of data insights and advanced analytics as a key and strategic area in the field of business analytics
You will support in definition and execution of global business analytics strategy, help to position business analytics team as central point of contact for all data analytics questions and use cases
Will be under your responsibility the execution/ management of projects within the area of advanced business analytics closely aligned with business and senior management
Also, you will ensure the Coaching and Training of virtual teams and functional areas within the core disciplines of analytics
You will actively participate in the processes of digitization and automation of tasks, contributing to the company's evolution towards digital transformation


What Makes You Great


You have 5-7 years of experience in analytical insights and data science and hold a master‚Äôs degree in STEM from a prestigious university
Also, you have a natural ability to turn concepts into computational systems and transform business questions into data-driven insights
In addition, you have strong expertise in Finance, Sales, and Supply Chain processes
You are an expert in data modeling, feature engineering, and have strong knowledge of SQL, R, R Shiny, and Python
Furthermore, you have a solid understanding of data and system architectures and their role in digital transformation
You possess excellent English communication skills and can effectively engage with technical and business teams
Also, you have experience in Scrum and Agile methodologies to manage projects and drive high-performing teams
Additionally you are willing to travel when necessary to support business initiatives
You are ready to face new challenges and actively contribute to the success of the company's digital transformation project
You are able to collect, interpret and use data effectively, driving digital transformation


Why you will love working with us

At Linde we identify ourselves with our products ‚Äì either working for the technical or medical gases business. Being a company with a long tradition in the gases business, we not only care about our customers and high quality products, but most importantly about our employees. While working with us, expect a safe workplace, high safety standards and a true commitment from our managers to safety.

What we offer you!

At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you‚Äôre looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless.

This role is a full time position based on an unlimited contract. The standard weekly working hours will be from 08:00 hrs till 17:00 hrs.

Have we inspired you? Let¬¥s talk about it

We are looking forward to receiving your complete application (motivation letter, CV, certificates) via our online job market.

Any designations used of course apply to persons of all genders. The form of speech used here is for simplicity only.

Linde acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
üåü Opportunity : Machine Learning Engineer

Our client is a global leader and fast-growing data science powerhouse committed to excellence in transforming complex data into actionable insights. With a diverse team of experts from around the world, they strive to be the foremost partner in advanced analytics, predictive modeling, and digital transformation, empowering organizations to achieve breakthrough performance and a competitive edge.

This role blends deep technical expertise with innovation, contributing directly to R&D efforts while developing scalable, intelligent systems using both traditional and state-of-the-art machine learning techniques, including Large Language Models (LLMs).

üöÄ Responsibilities :


Design, build, and maintain scalable ML pipelines from feature engineering to production deployment and monitoring.
Collaborate with Data Scientists to transition models from experimentation to production, ensuring system performance and reliability.
Lead or support R&D initiatives applying innovative ML techniques, including LLMs, to solve real-world challenges.
Contribute to the design and implementation of database architectures supporting scalable ML workflows.
Work within the E-commerce vertical, powering personalized, intelligent, and high-performing AI solutions.
Help develop the foundations of a Vertical AI platform, combining cutting-edge ML techniques with robust software design.
Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines, testing frameworks, and observability tools for ML systems.
Participate in technical discussions, architecture design, and code reviews, contributing to team-level decisions.


üë§ Profile sought :

Education :

Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related field.

Technical Skills :


3+ years of experience developing and deploying ML systems in production environments.
Strong proficiency in Python and experience with ML libraries such as scikit-learn, XGBoost, PyTorch, or TensorFlow.
Experience designing and managing relational (e.g., PostgreSQL), document-based (e.g., MongoDB), and graph-based (e.g., Neo4j) databases.
Previous exposure to LLMs and/or Recommendation Systems is a plus.
Familiarity with MLOps practices and cloud-based deployments (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
Solid programming background with a focus on creating robust, maintainable, and scalable solutions.


üåç Benefits & Culture :


Bonus Salary Policy: Enjoy a 15th-month bonus.
Additional Vacation: Receive 4 extra vacation days to support a healthy work-life balance.
International Exposure: Get the opportunity to participate in international projects that broaden your professional experience.
Professional Development: Benefit from company-paid certifications, extensive training, and continuous career progression support.
Home Office Support: A dedicated home office budget is provided to ensure you have the necessary tools and equipment.
Team Building and Culture: Engage in team building activities within an innovative, young, and dynamic work environment.


üíº Department : Data Science

üìç Location : Based in Porto, Portugal. Although there is the possibility of remote working, we are only considering people located in Portugal.

üìÜ Starting date : ASAP

Title: Data Science Associate
Description:
Who We Are




Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.




We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.




What We Offer




A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.




What you will do




Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.




What you‚Äôll bring




3+ years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role.
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English (written and spoken)




Nice to have:




Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).




In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: AI Specialist | Porto
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




‚Ä¢ DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




‚Ä¢ DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




‚Ä¢ DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term values.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a AI Specialist for an hybrid project in Porto (1 day a week at the office).




Responsabilities:

Implementation of new AI tools;
Working on POC‚Äôs for AI integration;
Model training.




Requirements:

Previous experience in similar functions;
Experience in Copilot Studio, OpenAI GPT, LLAMA, Anthropic, DeepSeek and other public models;
Fluency in english.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV to catia.carvalho@decskill.com, with the reference ‚ÄúCC/AI‚Äù.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

  • Implementation of new AI tools;
  • Working on POC‚Äôs for AI integration;
  • Model training.


Requirements:

  • Previous experience in similar functions;
  • Experience in Copilot Studio, OpenAI GPT, LLAMA, Anthropic, DeepSeek and other public models;
  • Fluency in english.


If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV to catia.carvalho@decskill.com, with the reference ‚ÄúCC/AI‚Äù.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Python Developer (FastAPI or Flask)
Description:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.




We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.




With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:

Are you ready to shape the future with one of the world‚Äôs leading technology giants? We are looking for a Python Developer (FastAPI or Flask) to integrate a global powerhouse - the forefront of digital transformation, engineering solutions that redefine industries, improve lives, and create a sustainable tomorrow.




#Oporto (hybrid).




What you will do:

In this role as a Python Developer, you will engage directly with business stakeholders to understand their challenges and provide innovative solutions tailored to their needs. Your work will involve designing and implementing applications that support business objectives in an agile environment, ensuring scalability and efficiency.

As part of an international team, you will be responsible for maintaining and enhancing company' corporate platforms by developing new functionalities and improving existing ones. Your role will cover the entire software development lifecycle, including specification, design, implementation, testing, and bug fixes.




Here, we don‚Äôt just embrace innovation ‚Äì we drive it!




What you are like:

3+ Years of work experience with Python Backend Development;
Experience with developing web API frameworks (FastAPI or Flask);
Knowledgeable on writing unit tests (Pytest);
Experience working with graph databases such as Neo4J or similar technologies;
Good experience of working with CI/CD pipelines with Gitlab for automated deployments
Comfortable with the english language (mandatory).




Why join us

Work on challenging projects for big clients
Learn more about emerging technologies
Possibility of working remotely
Design your career plan
Access to continuous training and certifications
Evolve through our internal mobility program
‚Ä¶ and much more!

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Your responsibilities




We‚Äôre looking for a Python Developer (F/M/D) with a passion for building robust back-end services to join our team and contribute to the development of our web-based product: the AI-powered CELUS Engineering Platform, which automates the electronics engineering process and significantly reduces development time. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Python development and a commitment to seamless user experiences. In this role you will:




Participate in the development of the back-end web applications and REST APIs, leveraging your existing web development experience.
Write efficient, readable, and maintainable Python code, embracing challenging tasks that extend beyond conventional Python API development.
Interact with a wide variety of tasks, from building APIs to coming up with clever business logic.
Interface and team up with other areas of engineering to solve diverse back-end problems, from third-party integrations to data modelling.




Your profile




3+ years of Python experience, including familiarity with Python web frameworks, preferably FastAPI, pydantic
Competence in using pytest and linters to ensure code quality
Knowledge of ORM on python and databases, MongoDB and SQL preferred
Ability to write highly legible code, using design patterns and generally accepted best practices
Knowledge of micro-service architecture is highly advantageous but not essential
Fluent in written and spoken English
Agile-mindset and solution driven way of thinking
Fluent in written and spoken English




We offer:

Shape the future

Have a direct impact on the electronics industry with our agile and international team.




Feel welcome

Enjoy our startup atmosphere and get to know the CELUS team at regular team events and our annual company offsite.




Lunch on us

Enjoy meal allowance, with a Coverflex card, which can be used in restaurants, supermarkets, food delivery services within the VISA network.




Stay healthy

Benefit from Private Health Insurance through the leading health insurance brand in Portugal, ensuring peace of mind for your well-being.




Learn and develop

Improve your skills with our learning platforms, English/Portuguese language classes, trainings and workshops.




Decide where and when you work

Enjoy hybrid office environment with home office allowance, flexible working schedule, ‚Äúworkation‚Äù program, 24 vacation days plus additional paid Christmas week holiday.

Title: Python Developer
HTML:
Noesis Is Looking For Professionals With The Following Profile

  • Bachelor's degree or higher in Information Technology or Computer Engineering or related field;
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with Python development;
  • Previous experience with SQL and relational databases;
  • Experience in REST APIs and synchronous messaging;
  • Experience in Docker (from the developer's point of view);
  • Experience in Git;
  • Knowledge of microservices design patterns;
  • Knowledge of CI/CD;
  • Previous contact with unit, integration and end-to-end testing;
  • Organizational and communication skills;
  • Proactivity and dynamism;
  • Good English level.

If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

Join us. Let's innovate together!

All our recruitment and selection processes are based on equal opportunities, valuing the competence and potential of each person and ensuring that no candidate is discriminated on the grounds of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, religion or physical condition.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Start your exciting journey with Aubay right here

Aubay Portugal is a subsidiary of the multinational French company, Aubay Group, present in Portugal since 2007. With offices in Lisbon and Porto, we are a leading provider of consulting services, specializing in the management, implementation, development, and maintenance of information systems.

Our expertise spans a wide range of industries, including banking, insurance, telecommunications, energy, transportation, and services, where we collaborate with over 150 active partners to deliver innovative, tailored solutions.

At Aubay, we‚Äôre committed to empowering businesses through digital transformation, offering cutting-edge technology and deep industry knowledge to drive success.




What are you going to do

Develop and maintain software solutions using Python with a focus on clean, efficient code.
Create and manage automation scripts within Linux environments.
Utilize other scripting languages, especially Shell scripts, to support system and application tasks.
Use version control systems to manage codebase changes and collaborate with the development team.




What are we looking for

At least 6 years of solid experience in Python programming and development.
Strong background in scripting for Linux operating systems.
Proficiency with other scripting languages, particularly Shell scripting.
Experience using version control tools, with a preference for Git.




What do we offer you?

At Aubay, we believe in creating an environment where both your career and well-being thrive. Here's what you can expect when you join us:

Health Insurance: Your health and well-being are a priority.
Feedback&Coffee: A unique system that integrates Aubay's Performance Management Cycle with regular feedback sessions and a Career Progression Model, designed to foster your growth and success.
Working Model: Hybrid model with office in Porto/Braga.
A Tailored Training Academy: We‚Äôre dedicated to your professional development with both technical and behavioral training. From e-Learning and classroom sessions to Meet&Techs, Webinars, and Mentoring, we provide a variety of learning opportunities to suit your needs.
Exciting Events & Teambuilding: Enjoy a vibrant company culture through regular events and team-building activities that strengthen relationships and enhance collaboration.




What makes us different?

At Aubay, we foster a unique environment where people come first. Here‚Äôs what makes us different:

A Culture Built on Core Values: Our organizational culture thrives on transparency, team spirit, regular feedback, and continuous learning ‚Äî all designed to support your personal and professional growth.
Recognition & Rewards: Enjoy reference prizes and a birthday gift as a token of appreciation for being part of our team.
Freedom in Expression: We embrace a casual dress code, allowing you to feel comfortable and authentic at work.
A Friendly and Inclusive Atmosphere: At Aubay, we know your name, and we communicate informally ‚Äî fostering a relaxed, close-knit environment.
Grow with Us: You will grow alongside inspiring colleagues who support and challenge you. Isn't this the best way to develop professionally?




If we‚Äôve sparked your interest, we‚Äôre now ready to ignite your enthusiasm. Are you ready for the first step?

We are waiting for you at maria.t.moreno@aubay.pt!

Personal Data collected by AUBAY PORTUGAL as Data Controller, regarding the identification, contact and professional capabilities of the candidates, in the present procedure, will be processed for the application analysis, having in consideration that the processing is conducted in order to to take the steps, at the request of the data subject, prior to entering into a contract; Personal data sent through the present application will be kept by Aubay during the application procedure and will remain stored whilst updated (for two years period). The collected data might be transferred or include other processing actitivites, as long as the data subject is informed, in the occurrence of a standard application and selection procedure, for the compliance of legal obligations for the time required by law. For any queries or request regarding personal data protection rights, the Data Subject may contact AUBAY PORTUGAL‚Äôs headquarters in Avenida Duque D`√Åvila, n¬∫46 em Lisboa or use the DPO‚Äôs e-mail - dpo@aubay.pt. The Data Subject also has the right to file a complaint with the National Data Protection Authority ‚Äì www.cnpd.pt. (please do not include data regarding racial or ethnical origins, political opinions, religion, philosophy, biometrical data, health data, sexual life and orientation, or relating to criminal convictions and offences.)

Title: Senior Data Scientist
HTML:
The Tribe

'Prozis is a powerhouse product developing company. Every day we make new products. That is only possible because we developed our own proprietary technology that ensures that we bring you high quality, beautiful and fair priced products. We endure in our philosophy of a 4.0 vertical process, manufacturing in our own facilities or with the help of our superpartners. We do everything: idea, concept, design, manufacturing, quality control, marketing, sales, logistics, printing, distribution, client support, software development, photo, video, 3D and philosophy. We deliver wherever you are, whenever you want. We don‚Äôt compromise. We breathe technology, drink design and feed on our will to exceed ourselves making the best products in the world. This all starts in 2007 with a crazy guy in a garage that thinks he can change the world for the better. Right now, we are hundreds, going to thousands of crazy but focused people. Will is a skill. There is a lot of people that want to buy us out. We don‚Äôt have a F****** price tag. It‚Äôs not about the money. It‚Äôs about our mission. Trust us. We will feed your body and mind with everything you need to exceed yourself.'

- miguel milh√£o


The Team

Prozis is growing and Data is flying everywhere, do you think you can catch it? Prozis Data Analytics Team collaborates with multiple business stakeholders, including C-level, and has a value-driven proposition in the company.


The Role

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be working in a multitalented team and your role will be analyzing large amounts of data, diving deep to identify business insights and opportunities, design simulations and experiments, developing statistical and ML models by tailoring to business needs, and collaborating with other Data Scientists, Data Analysts, Business Intelligence Engineers and Data Engineers.

You will be responsible for the following topics:

  • Explore, clean, manipulate and analyze valuable data from different data sources with SQL, Python, Scala or equivalent;
  • Translate product objectives to data science problems and vice-versa;
  • Proactively perform data exploration to uncover future opportunities;
  • Work with large and complex datasets, applying statistical analysis, data mining, and machine learning techniques to solve e-commerce business challenges;
  • Develop and deploy predictive models for customer segmentation, demand forecasting, product recommendation, and customer lifetime value (LTV) measurement;
  • Build and maintain data pipelines and interactive dashboards to monitor KPIs and support decision-making processes;
  • Conduct exploratory analyses to identify patterns, trends, and improvement opportunities across the customer journey;
  • Collaborate with Product, Marketing, Operations, and Technology teams to define metrics, test hypotheses, and propose data-driven improvements;
  • Lead experimentation projects (A/B testing), ensuring methodological rigor and extracting actionable business insights;
  • Mentor and support junior data scientists and analysts, fostering technical growth within the team;
  • Clearly communicate analytical results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, translating insights into strategic recommendations.


You

You are an amazing professional, with a degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or a related field, experience in a similar role and knowledge of at least some of the following:

  • Solid experience (minimum 4 years) in data science, preferably within e-commerce, retail, or marketplaces;
  • Ability to model analytical and statistical problems as well as different validation techniques;
  • Strong knowledge of SQL;
  • Python (or similar) programming skills using machine learning experimentation and development best practices;
  • Experience with Data Visualization for technical & non-technical audiences;
  • Knowledge of Big Data and Cloud technologies is a plus (PySpark, Spark, Hive, Azure, Databricks).


Nice to Have

  • Experience with NLP (Natural Language Processing) techniques;
  • Background in product recommendation systems, dynamic pricing, or optimization of digital marketing campaigns.


What are your superpowers?

  • Strong technical and analytical skills in the realm of Data;
  • Proactivity and autonomy;
  • Good collaboration and communication skills;
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.


Btw: Prozis is not for everyone.

Title: Data Scientist for Process Mining (f/m/div)
Description:
Our Processes team is shaping Infineon's future by delivering meaningful insights to our internal customers and empowering them to drive their business forward. Are you a hands-on driven, innovative person who is interested in using your technical and analytical skills to help other teams? Apply now to become our Data Scientist for Process Mining and dive into your passion for business processes and process mining!

Job Description

As a Data Scientist, you will use process mining to provide meaningful insights to our internal customers in order to support their choices to lead their future business. Furthermore, you will analyze diverse data sources to extract new and actionable discoveries.

In your new role you will:


Describe process model requirements and identify IT application data needed for implementation of process models, cooperating with business process experts and IT application owners
Define and implement process models using SQL and Infineon‚Äôs process mining platform mpmX by:
Taking ownership over developed process models and assuring their maintenance and continuous improvement
Consulting on the capabilities of process mining, providing trainings for end users
Proactively explore new areas for Process Mining
Support the maintenance and scalability of the developed Process Mining solutions
Assure availability, integrity and quality of developed data models in a dedicated process mining database
Become familiar with business processes built up in models across diverse functional domains
Provide support in scouting and observation of process mining provider market as well as newest capabilities, ensuring continuous exchange with other process mining developers

Your Profile

You have a proactive working style and technical expertise that fit perfectly in a multinational and dynamic environment. You are a hands-on and innovative person who is able to communicate well with different levels and functions of the organization. Your great consulting and moderation skills allow you to explain solutions in person and in writing. Furthermore, your high-quality standards and agile mindset allow you to use your thorough analysis skills and produce efficient results.

You are best equipped for this task if you have:


A degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Natural Science, Engineering or similar field
At least 3 years of professional experience in relevant areas, preferable in an international company
Experience with Process Mining and data analysis and visualization is a big advantage
Data manipulation skills for at least one well-known database system like Oracle or MS SQL (T-SQL, stored procedures, dbt ‚Äì Data Build Tool)
Experience in at least one programming language
Familiarity with business processes is an advantage
Fluency in English. German is an advantage


Please send us your CV in English

Contact:

Cl√°udia Rodrigues, LinkedIn

#WeAreIn for driving decarbonization and digitalization.

As a global leader in semiconductor solutions in power systems and IoT, Infineon enables game-changing solutions for green and efficient energy, clean and safe mobility, as well as smart and secure IoT. Together, we drive innovation and customer success, while caring for our people and empowering them to reach ambitious goals. Be a part of making life easier, safer and greener.

Are you in?


Welcome at Infineon Technologies Business Solutions in Porto! -


Infineon Technologies Business Solutions is a vibrant global hub, driven by diverse talents and an operational culture of excellence, in a privileged geographic location. The team of more than 25 nationalities works together in a dynamic, diverse and inclusive environment. We lead innovation and digital transformation, shaping the future of Infineon Technologies. At the heart of everything we do, people matter most. Our ultimate goal is to craft a unique experience for both our customers and employees.

At our site you will find a range of diverse teams that have built a reputation for delivering high-quality services for all Infineon in Finance, Procurement, Human Resources, IT, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Business Continuity and Sustainability, Cyber Security, Communication, Corporate Supply Chain Logistics and Sales & Marketing. Porto is a powerhouse of ideas and solutions, a key player in the global company‚Äôs puzzle, delivering specialized services and innovative solutions.

Together, Infineon Technologies Business Solutions will continue to shape the future, driving innovation and excellence for years to come.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. HTML:
Our Processes team is shaping Infineon's future by delivering meaningful insights to our internal customers and empowering them to drive their business forward. Are you a hands-on driven, innovative person who is interested in using your technical and analytical skills to help other teams? Apply now to become our Data Scientist for Process Mining and dive into your passion for business processes and process mining!

Job Description

As a Data Scientist, you will use process mining to provide meaningful insights to our internal customers in order to support their choices to lead their future business. Furthermore, you will analyze diverse data sources to extract new and actionable discoveries.

In your new role you will:

  • Describe process model requirements and identify IT application data needed for implementation of process models, cooperating with business process experts and IT application owners
  • Define and implement process models using SQL and Infineon‚Äôs process mining platform mpmX by:
    • Taking ownership over developed process models and assuring their maintenance and continuous improvement
    • Consulting on the capabilities of process mining, providing trainings for end users
  • Proactively explore new areas for Process Mining
  • Support the maintenance and scalability of the developed Process Mining solutions
  • Assure availability, integrity and quality of developed data models in a dedicated process mining database
  • Become familiar with business processes built up in models across diverse functional domains
  • Provide support in scouting and observation of process mining provider market as well as newest capabilities, ensuring continuous exchange with other process mining developers
Your Profile

You have a proactive working style and technical expertise that fit perfectly in a multinational and dynamic environment. You are a hands-on and innovative person who is able to communicate well with different levels and functions of the organization. Your great consulting and moderation skills allow you to explain solutions in person and in writing. Furthermore, your high-quality standards and agile mindset allow you to use your thorough analysis skills and produce efficient results.

You are best equipped for this task if you have:

  • A degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Natural Science, Engineering or similar field
  • At least 3 years of professional experience in relevant areas, preferable in an international company
  • Experience with Process Mining and data analysis and visualization is a big advantage
  • Data manipulation skills for at least one well-known database system like Oracle or MS SQL (T-SQL, stored procedures, dbt ‚Äì Data Build Tool)
  • Experience in at least one programming language
  • Familiarity with business processes is an advantage
  • Fluency in English. German is an advantage

Please send us your CV in English

Contact:

Cl√°udia Rodrigues, LinkedIn

#WeAreIn for driving decarbonization and digitalization.

Title: Data Science Lead
HTML:
Who We Are


Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.


We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.


What We Offer


  • A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
  • Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
  • Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
  • Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
  • Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
  • Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.


What you will do


  • Manage client interactions and play a key role in building and maintaining client relationships;
  • Apply knowledge of data science concepts to translate business problems to analytics solutions with clear output and with foreseen impactful outcomes;
  • Provide project management oversight required to meet client expectations;
  • Responsibilities may include the development of presentations and managing of external relationships;
  • Seek compelling opportunities beyond the scope of the current project;
  • Provide guidance to more junior members of the team, while orchestrating the work of the entire team.


What you‚Äôll bring


  • Master (or Ph.D.) degree in a quantitative field with a focus on data analysis (e.g. econometrics, AI, mathematics, physics, and other exact sciences);
  • Sharp thinking ability to be able to quickly differentiate major contributors from irrelevant details and to hierarchically structure information residing in the data under analysis;
  • Robust knowledge of statistical concepts, accompanied by expertise with a set of analytical tools ranging from databases (e.g. SQL, BigQuery, noSQL) to programming languages (e.g. R, Python), and from data visualization (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI) to machine learning.
  • Understanding data engineering solutions is a plus;
  • Proven ability to manage projects with expert team members and to provide inspiring guidance to juniors in the team;
  • 5+ years of consulting experience or relevant industry experience, with at least 1+ years at a project lead level;
  • Excellent communication skills, especially to explain complex analytical concepts in non-technical terms to business users;
  • Professional fluency in English.


In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Desenvolvedor Python
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?




Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others ‚Äì, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.




We are seeking a skilled Python Developer eager to take on new challenges in a hybrid work model in Porto.




Are you the one?




Code and test software components and parts assigned to them for the technical domains under their responsibility in compliance with development and security norms and standards.
Help in the design, model and implementation of the product‚Äôs solution, as necessary, with the objective of optimize the quality of the code and its future maintainability.
Participate in the delivery of the product components in the different environments, in close collaboration with other teams whenever necessary.
Act as a reference in the function and capitalize on the gathered experience to share knowledge, train and coach others.
Python Programming
Flask / Fast API
SQL
Javascript
Angular
English (C1)

Helping you reach happiness.

Several challenging complex projects.
Stimulating teams and leaders.
World-class Clients and Partners.




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to catarina.rolo@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.

At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.
