Title: Python Developer
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for a Python Developer!




Responsibilities:

Primary goal will be to continually improve the core framework used for data integration and calculation of Market and Counterparty Risk Metrics.
Innovation is a key element of Risk Systems, so candidates will have the opportunity to collaborate in cross-team innovative projects and propose initiatives aligned with our top innovation priorities.
Develop and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Python code.
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.
Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications.
Ensure code documentation and organization.
Incrementally deliver applications to meet dynamic customer requirements.
Resolve incidents in a production environment.
Collaborate with different stakeholders in the solution of problems and blockages.




Requirements:

Experience with Python.
Experience with SQL and any industry standard relational database.
Demonstrable ability to write clean and readable code
Solid understanding of both object-oriented and functional programming paradigms
Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
English required, both spoken and written.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com or career@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúPython‚Äù.




Thank You! üòä




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being

Title: Python Developer
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business.

We are looking for a Python Developer to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).

You Must Have

  • Between 6-9 years of experience working in a similar role;
  • Strong proficiency in Pure Python;
  • Good understanding of Python libraries (Pandas);
  • Experience with SSAS and SSRS;
  • Power BI is a plus;
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, enabling effective collaboration with cross-functional teams and stakeholders;
  • Good level of English (B2).

What can you expect from us?

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: Lead Data Scientist
Description:
üåü Opportunity : Chapter Lead Data Scientist

Our client is a global leader and fast-growing data science powerhouse committed to excellence in transforming complex data into actionable insights. With a diverse team of experts from around the world, they strive to be the foremost partner in advanced analytics, predictive modeling, and digital transformation, empowering organizations to achieve breakthrough performance and a competitive edge.

üöÄ Responsibilities :


Contribute to shaping the Data Science department and technical vision.
Maintain an overview of the full Data Science project portfolio, identifying opportunities to connect technical efforts and ensure consistency in quality and methodologies.
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders and sales teams to align technical solutions with client needs.
Mentor and coach team members, promoting best practices in code quality, model development, and lifecycle management.
Lead internal initiatives focused on knowledge sharing, technical excellence, and team cohesion.
Support the career development of more junior team members.
Oversee CI/CD processes for deployed solutions and participate in code and algorithm reviews.


üë§ Profile sought :

Education :

Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related field.

Technical Skills :


3+ years of experience in Python, Data Science, and Machine Learning, with at least 1 year in a technical leadership role.
Proven track record of ownership across the full Data Science lifecycle: from conceptualization to implementation and stakeholder communication.
Solid theoretical foundation combined with strong implementation skills.
Experience supporting and connecting the work of Data Scientists with other development teams (e.g., Data Engineering, DevOps).
Strong programming background, with a focus on best practices for building robust and maintainable solutions.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and a collaborative mindset.
Experience with Recommendation Systems and/or Customer Journey Modelling in a B2B setting is a plus.


üåç Benefits & Culture :


Bonus Salary Policy: Enjoy a 15th-month bonus.
Additional Vacation: Receive 4 extra vacation days to support a healthy work-life balance.
International Exposure: Get the opportunity to participate in international projects that broaden your professional experience.
Professional Development: Benefit from company-paid certifications, extensive training, and continuous career progression support.
Home Office Support: A dedicated home office budget is provided to ensure you have the necessary tools and equipment.
Team Building and Culture: Engage in team building activities within an innovative, young, and dynamic work environment.


üíº Department : Data Science

üìç Location : Based in Porto, Portugal. Although there is the possibility of remote working, we are only considering people located in Portugal.

üìÜ Starting date : ASAP

Title: Python Developer
Description:
We are using and creating technology to transform operations at sea to enable people and the planet to thrive.




We are open-minded and fearless in our approach to innovation and don't believe in boundaries. We challenge everything and have massive ambitions to drag aging industries into the tech era.




We take safety, equality and education very seriously, and our responsibilities don't stop at our front door. Our business is built on the belief that there's definitely a more environmentally responsible way to operate at sea.




We employ people who share our core values. We expect our people to be courageous, trustworthy, and conscientious, driven by a desire to do the right thing. We strive for excellence, work collaboratively, and are genuinely excited by our work.




We offer opportunities for our people to develop beyond their role and span a multitude of disciplines. These are open to all, regardless of background and experience level. Working with us means being part of a team that is harnessing technology and creativity to disrupt a traditional industry.




We are not your average workplace.




Ocean Infinity is seeking an experienced python developer to support the AI team in developing and deploying cutting edge automation in the maritime industry. The position is part of a team that focuses on processing and analysing sonar data from subsea operations, and is reporting to the AI team lead.




What will you do:

Design, develop, and maintain Python applications and data pipelines to support the processing of maritime data.
Transform raw data into formats suitable for machine learning training and inference, and export results into user-friendly formats for operational teams and downstream systems.
Ensure code quality and maintainability by applying software engineering best practices, including modular design, testing, and documentation.
Collaborate closely with AI Engineers, ML Engineers, and other stakeholders to deliver robust and efficient solutions that bridge the gap between model development and production integration.
Perform data quality checks, troubleshoot processing issues, and implement preventive measures to ensure pipeline reliability and scalability.
Build prototypes and proof-of-concept applications to validate new approaches or technologies.
Deploy and support services in production environments, ensuring performance, reliability, and maintainability.
Contribute to continuous improvement efforts by identifying inefficiencies and proposing enhancements to infrastructure and workflows.




Who you are:

A degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Familiarity with Linux/WSL.
Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and data modelling.
Experience in working with JIRA and Confluence in an Agile environment.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work in a team environment.
Strong analytical skills and a proactive problem-solving mind.




Desirable:

Experience with data engineering/data pipelines.
Experience with Docker.
Experience implementing continuous integration and/or continuous deployment.
Experience with frontend development.




Salary for this position: Up to ‚Ç¨50,000 per annum




Salary: The salary varies for this position as we are recruiting in multiple regional locations and job grades. The salary process is based on skills, abilities, and experience required.




What you can expect:




At Ocean Infinity, we believe in creating equal opportunities for all, celebrating each and everyone‚Äôs differences. We are driven by transforming the industry, through our technology, thoughts, behaviours and actions. Being inclusive and respectful to all is fundamental to who we are. It is the right thing to do and enables innovation and creativity to thrive.




There is more work to be done, and we know that we aren‚Äôt perfect, but our commitment to these values is unwavering. They are central to our mission and the impact we have on the industry, meaning, we cannot live without them.

Show more
HTML:
We are using and creating technology to transform operations at sea to enable people and the planet to thrive.


We are open-minded and fearless in our approach to innovation and don't believe in boundaries. We challenge everything and have massive ambitions to drag aging industries into the tech era.


We take safety, equality and education very seriously, and our responsibilities don't stop at our front door. Our business is built on the belief that there's definitely a more environmentally responsible way to operate at sea.


We employ people who share our core values. We expect our people to be courageous, trustworthy, and conscientious, driven by a desire to do the right thing. We strive for excellence, work collaboratively, and are genuinely excited by our work.


We offer opportunities for our people to develop beyond their role and span a multitude of disciplines. These are open to all, regardless of background and experience level. Working with us means being part of a team that is harnessing technology and creativity to disrupt a traditional industry.


We are not your average workplace.


Ocean Infinity is seeking an experienced python developer to support the AI team in developing and deploying cutting edge automation in the maritime industry. The position is part of a team that focuses on processing and analysing sonar data from subsea operations, and is reporting to the AI team lead.


What will you do:

  • Design, develop, and maintain Python applications and data pipelines to support the processing of maritime data.
  • Transform raw data into formats suitable for machine learning training and inference, and export results into user-friendly formats for operational teams and downstream systems.
  • Ensure code quality and maintainability by applying software engineering best practices, including modular design, testing, and documentation.
  • Collaborate closely with AI Engineers, ML Engineers, and other stakeholders to deliver robust and efficient solutions that bridge the gap between model development and production integration.
  • Perform data quality checks, troubleshoot processing issues, and implement preventive measures to ensure pipeline reliability and scalability.
  • Build prototypes and proof-of-concept applications to validate new approaches or technologies.
  • Deploy and support services in production environments, ensuring performance, reliability, and maintainability.
  • Contribute to continuous improvement efforts by identifying inefficiencies and proposing enhancements to infrastructure and workflows.


Who you are:

  • A degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • Strong programming skills in Python.
  • Familiarity with Linux/WSL.
  • Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and data modelling.
  • Experience in working with JIRA and Confluence in an Agile environment.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work in a team environment.
  • Strong analytical skills and a proactive problem-solving mind.


Desirable:

  • Experience with data engineering/data pipelines.
  • Experience with Docker.
  • Experience implementing continuous integration and/or continuous deployment.
  • Experience with frontend development.


Salary for this position: Up to ‚Ç¨50,000 per annum


Salary: The salary varies for this position as we are recruiting in multiple regional locations and job grades. The salary process is based on skills, abilities, and experience required.


What you can expect:


At Ocean Infinity, we believe in creating equal opportunities for all, celebrating each and everyone‚Äôs differences. We are driven by transforming the industry, through our technology, thoughts, behaviours and actions. Being inclusive and respectful to all is fundamental to who we are. It is the right thing to do and enables innovation and creativity to thrive.


There is more work to be done, and we know that we aren‚Äôt perfect, but our commitment to these values is unwavering. They are central to our mission and the impact we have on the industry, meaning, we cannot live without them.

English

Title: Python Developer
Description:
At ALTEN, we are certain that the success of our projects is due to the people who make up our team. That‚Äôs why, if you have at least 3 years of experience as a Python Developer we are committed to boosting your talent, meeting your professional expectations, and making you feel right at home. Do you want to build the world of tomorrow today? Keep reading!




Mandatory skills requested for this position:

Strong technical expertise in Python (Native and frameworks);
Significant experience in industrializing developments (Design Patterns, DevOps, standards, clean code, best practices);
Pedagogical qualities adapted to supporting the developers on the platform.




Technical Skills:




Notable experience in enterprise software development/Software Engineering (Git, Gitlab, unit tests, etc.)
Expertise in Python (at least 3.9) and its ecosystem (libraries, Anaconda, Jupyter, VS Code, etc.)
Expertise in computational libraries and data manipulation (NumPy, Pandas, etc.)
Expertise in parallelization and performance optimization (Dask, Spark, GPU optimization, Cuda, Cupy, etc.)
Expertise in industrializing Python developments (development standards, Design patterns, TDD, etc.)
Ability to understand functional needs and translate them into IT requirements
Creation of Python packages
DevOps: Jira, CI/CD, Gitlab CI, Jenkins, Artifactory, shell script, Docker, Hashicorp Vault, Jfrog
Code quality: Fortify, Nexus IQ, Sonarqube
Databases: Oracle, PostgreSQL, Netezza
File management: S3, Boto3, IBM COS, Minio
Data Engineering, data manipulation, data exploration, data quality, etc.
Ability to challenge project stakeholders (e.g., Business, MOA, MOE)
High level of English.




What can we offer you?

Joining a competitive, multinational company that is constantly growing.
Integration into a highly qualified team of professionals with a great work environment‚Äîinnovative and dynamic.
Specialized training and ongoing professional development.
Social benefits.
Competitive salary.




Who are we?

We are a team. We are part of ALTEN, a European multinational specializing in providing consulting, information technology, and engineering services to the leading companies in the Portuguese market.

If you like numbers, we can tell you that in Portugal we have a revenue of 10.9 million euros, 2 headquarters, and a team of 215 professionals.

Moreover, at ALTEN, we take pride in offering equal opportunities regardless of gender, age, abilities, or country of origin. Our commitment is to talent and to the people who possess it.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Computer Vision
Description:
We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist who is not only technically proficient but also a proven leader and innovator. You will be instrumental in driving our data science initiatives forward, ensuring all our work adheres to the highest standards of the medical device industry. This is an opportunity to make a significant and immediate impact. We are looking for a candidate with a robust background and a passion for data science, particularly within the medical field.




Qualifications




You have a PhD or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Electrical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
You can effectively translate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
You have proven leadership experience with a track record of successfully delivering complex projects.
You have extensive hands-on experience with image models and relevant deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.
You have deep expertise in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services relevant to data science, including Vertex AI, AI Platform, Cloud Storage, Compute Engine, Dataflow, and BigQuery for large-scale data warehousing and analytics.
You have a strong understanding of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles and experience working with MLOps pipelines.
You have solid experience navigating data compliance challenges within the medical field and with medical devices. This includes familiarity with regulations like HIPAA, GDPR standards, and an understanding of the unique data challenges and ethical considerations inherent in this critical industry.







Key Responsibilities




Leading the design, development, and deployment of machine learning models specifically for medical device applications.
Guiding the team in selecting appropriate methodologies, algorithms, and tools for diverse data science problems.
Ensuring the scalability, robustness, and maintainability of data science solutions in a production environment.
Overseeing and architecting the entire data lifecycle, from ingestion and transformation to storage and access, while ensuring data quality and availability.
Spearheading data compliance efforts within the data science team, ensuring strict adherence to regulations pertinent to the medical field and medical devices (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, FDA regulations, ISO 13485, MDR/IVDR, and the Data Act).
Collaborating closely with legal, regulatory, product and quality assurance teams to ensure all data science initiatives meet the highest compliance standards.
Providing technical guidance and mentorship to junior and mid-level data scientists, fostering their growth and skill development.
Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills and a collaborative spirit.
Contributing to the strategic direction of the data science team, aligning data initiatives with broader business objectives.




Show more

Title: Python Backend Developer (HYBRID @PORTO)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: PYTHON Developer

Seniority: 4+

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week at Porto Office)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in software development with Python, with a strong background in backend development.
Strong knowledge of object-oriented programming principles, design patterns, and software engineering best practices.
Comfortable working with SQL and No-SQL Databases.
Basic knowledge of the Linux command line.
Experience with Clouds, Rest API‚Äôs and Microservices Architectures.
DevOps mindset (CI/CD knowledge) and experience with tests.
Understanding of software development methodologies, such as Agile or Scrum, and experience working in collaborative development environments.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to quickly understand and debug complex software applications.
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal).
Fluency in English is mandatory.







To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

Related Certifications.







Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefer the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!




Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Innovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

Title: Python Fullstack Developer
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Python Fullstack Developer for a hybrid project based in Porto (2x/Week).


Requirements:

  • Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields;
  • 3+ years of Full-Stack development experience, end-to-end web application delivery;
  • Professional experience with Python Web Frameworks (Django, Flask, FastAPI).
  • Professional experience developing and maintaining data-centered APIs;
  • Work experience with Front-End frameworks (React, Angular);
  • Strong knowledge on Web UI and UX, with strong fundamentals (HTML, CSS, JS);
  • Strong knowledge on implementing authentication and directory services (SSO, LDAP);
  • Experience implementing RBAC models and User Management systems;
  • Knowledge on data analysis and data handling are a plus;
  • Knowledge on Plotly Dash is a plus;
  • Fluency in English (both written and spoken) is mandatory.


Responsibilities:

  • Develop, maintain and support modern, reactive and responsive Web Applications;
  • Develop, maintain and support custom APIs;
  • Develop and optimize solid backend solutions for both Web Applications and APIs, handling sometimes big volumes of data;
  • Integrate our interfaces with SSO systems;
  • Communicate with stakeholders and build the target Use Experience for our Web Applications; Communicate with stakeholders and achieve the desired outcome for our APIs
  • Develop, maintain and support RBAC and User Management models;
  • Understand and be the point of contact for the business and assess its needs;
  • Ensure that the target architecture meets business requirements;
  • Prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines and delivering high-quality results.


If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV to carolina.novais@decskill.com with reference CN/FSP.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
At Axians, we value talent, not labels.

We believe in a culture of inclusion, where everyone has a place and all applications are considered based on merit, without discrimination.

This is your opportunity to join an international group with a project that needs you to help meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to perform duties as a Python Developer for a national project.

üôÇ YOUR DAY TO DAY


Code and test software components and parts assigned to them for the technical domains under their responsibility in compliance with development and security norms and standards.
Help in the design, model and implementation of the product‚Äôs solution, as necessary, with the objective of optimize the quality of the code and its future maintainability.
Participate in the delivery of the product components in the different environments, in close collaboration with other teams whenever necessary.
Act as a reference in the function and capitalize on the gathered experience to share knowledge, train and coach others.


üí° What We're Looking For


Proficiency in Python Programming;
Proven experience with Flask / Fast API;
Experience with SQL;
Experience in Front-End programming is valued (Javascript / Angular);
Fluency in English (written & spoken).


‚≠ê What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject ‚ÄúPD/AS/MO‚Äù.

Title: AI-Enhanced Development Specialist
HTML:
We are looking for an AI-Enhanced Development Specialist, to join our client, a world leading multinational group in automotive wiring harness testing. With a direct contract with our client, you will be working remotely but need to be located on the north of the country.

What will be your main tasks and responsibilities?

  • Research, benchmark, and deploy AI-assisted development tools (e.g., GitHub Copilot, Cursor, Tabnine, etc.).;
  • Integrate AI coding tools into existing IDEs, CI/CD pipelines, and team workflows;
  • Lead pilot programs to measure and improve productivity through AI augmentation;
  • Provide hands-on training, workshops, and documentation to developers on best practices using AI tools;
  • Work closely with Engineering Managers and Tech Leads to identify bottlenecks where AI can add value;
  • Act as an internal champion for developer experience, automation, and intelligent tooling;
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in AI coding assistance, LLM APIs, and prompt engineering.

What will be required from you?

  • Degree in Computer Engineering;
  • Strong programming background in languages such as Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, C#, or Java;
  • Experience using or evaluating AI-assisted coding tools (e.g., GitHub Copilot, Cursor, Cody, Tabnine, CodeWhisperer);
  • Understanding of prompt engineering, tokenization, and LLM capabilites (OpenAI, Anthropic, Hugging Face, etc.);
  • Familiarity with modern development workflows: Git, CI/CD, Docker, tesing frameworks;
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain complex AI concepts to software teams;
  • Experience training or mentoring developers is a plus.
  • Fluent in English; Spanish is a plus.

Sounds like you? Send us your CV and let‚Äôs talk!

Title: Junior RAG Scientist | IS Team (Job Ref.: AICOS_Jobs_2025_15) | Porto, Portugal
HTML:
Job Title: Junior RAG Scientist

Job Ref: AICOS_Jobs_2025_15

Job Type: Full-time contract.

Job Location: Porto, Portugal.

Job Description And Responsibilities

Fraunhofer Portugal AICOSis seeking a talented Junior RAG Scientist to join our dynamic and multidisciplinary team within the Intelligent Systems group. In this role, you will be at the forefront of technological innovation, working on applied research projects that bridge the gap between cutting-edge research and real-world impact. You will contribute to initiatives that enhance industries, promote social well-being, and improve quality of life.

Your Role

  • Development and implementation of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Systems;
  • Create advanced RAG pipelines, semantically fusing technical documentation and logs;
  • Develop modules to manage complex documentation using advanced Large Language Models (LLMs).

Your Profile

Academic Qualifications:

  • Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent qualifications in Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Artificial Intelligence or related studies.

Technical Skills

  • Programming proficiency in Python and experience with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow;
  • Experience or strong interest in Large Language Models and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).

Other Skills

  • Excellent English communication skills (technical and general audiences);
  • Capacity to translate research findings into actionable insights for real-world applications.

We Value

  • Interest in advancing AI solutions that maintain robust performance under diverse and challenging conditions;
  • Commitment to clear and honest communication of data and model limitations using established reporting standards and tools;
  • Interest in applied research;
  • Ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary and cross-functional teams;
  • Autonomous, dependable, proactive, and a critical-thinking team player.

Why Should You Join Fraunhofer Portugal

  • Innovative Environment: Be part of a people-centric workplace that fosters creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. We encourage the development of new ideas and ensure that every voice is heard;
  • Research with Impact: Engage in projects that sit at the intersection of research and real-world applications, contributing to technology that makes a tangible difference in society;
  • Multidisciplinary Teams: Collaborate with professionals from diverse backgrounds, enhancing your learning and professional growth;
  • Professional Excellence: Work within a culture that upholds professional standards and best practices, promoting continuous improvement and excellence in research;
  • Flexible Work Arrangements: Benefit from flexible working hours and opportunities to work from home, supporting a healthy work-life balance;
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Benefit from a partially funded health insurance plan, and a variety of additional perks;
  • Supportive Culture: Join a team with an excellent spirit, where collaboration, mutual support, and team achievements are celebrated.

Application Process

Applications are permanently open until the ideal candidate is selected. The first evaluation of applications will occur on 28th of July 2025.

The selected candidate is expected to start working in September 2025.

To Apply

Send your application to jobs@fraunhofer.pt including:

  • Curriculum Vitae (mandatory);
  • Motivation Letter;
  • Recommendation Letters (optional but welcome).

Note

The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of the following projects:

  • AI4CarOps ‚Äì AI-Powered Innovations for Car Workshop Operations, with Notice No. MPr-2023-07- SIID-ID (Projetos em Copromo√ß√£o);
  • FIBFlow ‚Äì Financial Intelligent Business Flow, with Notice No. MPr-2023-08-SIID-ID (Projetos em Copromo√ß√£o);
  • Microelectr√≥nica ‚Äì Agenda Microeletr√≥nica, with Notice No. 01/C05-i01/2021 and Project Reference No. Projeto n¬∫ 19 NextGenerationEU (PRR).

Title: Python Backend Developer (onsite)
Description:
Company Description

MIR Insight forecasts demand and price developments in the materials industry, enabling companies to reduce waste and minimize losses. We are a fast-growing tech startup serving leading industry players such as K.D. Feddersen, Lenzing AG, and Jobachem, supported by international investors. Our goal is to provide our users with innovative, reliable, and user-friendly software. Join us on our mission to transform the manufacturing supply chain into a highly efficient, sustainable, and near-predictive economy.




Role Description

This is a full-time on-site role for a Python Backend Developer located in Maia. The Python Backend Developer will be responsible for developing and maintaining backend services, performing software development tasks, and implementing object-oriented programming principles. The role involves working with databases and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software solutions.

You‚Äôll take ownership of our orchestration and delivery pipelines, ensuring our data and models run seamlessly, reliably, and at scale. Working closely with our data science and product teams, you‚Äôll help automate and optimize the full forecasting lifecycle‚Äîfrom raw data ingestion to actionable results. Fullstack skills are a plus, allowing you to support lightweight frontend tools when needed.




What You‚Äôll Do

Build and manage orchestration workflows (e.g. Airflow, Prefect)
Develop backend services for ingesting, processing, and delivering forecasts
Monitor pipeline health and job performance; handle errors and retries proactively
Work with data scientists to integrate and scale forecasting models in production
Support internal tools and dashboards, optionally contributing frontend components
Implement auditability, logging, versioning, and performance monitoring
Improve and automate repetitive data handling and reporting tasks
Contribute to architectural decisions as we scale our infrastructure




Qualifications

Proficiency in Back-End Web Development and Software Development
Strong skills in Python and object-oriented programming, with experience developing production-grade backend services
Experience working with Postgresql
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
Ability to work on-site in Maia
Good communication skills in English
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Familiarity with agile methodologies is a plus
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, or cloud platforms is a plus
Bonus: exposure to frontend frameworks (React, Vue, etc.)
Bonus: experience in supply chain, manufacturing, or forecasting domains




What We Offer

The chance to shape the future of how companies plan and forecast
A high-performance, founder-led team and fast-paced startup culture
Salary with potential equity upside
Opportunity to grow into a team lead role as we scale
All the coffee that you could possibly drink

Title: (Senior) Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
Company Description

Continental develops pioneering technologies and services for sustainable and connected mobility of people and their goods. Founded in 1871, the technology company offers safe, efficient, intelligent and affordable solutions for vehicles, machines, traffic and transportation. In 2024, Continental generated sales of ‚Ç¨39.7 billion and currently employs around 190,000 people in 55 countries and markets.

Job Description

Continental‚Äôs digital capabilities are growing every day. Our eCommerce, Fleet Solutions and Data Science Information Technology team creates a wide range of technology solutions for Continental‚Äôs Global Sales and Marketing teams ‚Äì and we want you to join us!

Our Applied Analytics and AI team continuously works on the digitalization of our business-to-business processes and end consumer communication, using modern tech stacks with a strong focus on data science and artificial intelligence. Whether you want to optimize big production machines for an impact on sustainability or work with an international sales organization -we run a diverse range of operational data-driven products across the entire value chain of a tire.

If you‚Äôd love to join a global team that works on the latest technologies and creates value-added solutions for customers, Continental is the perfect match for you.

As Senior ML Engineer your main responsibilities will be:

  • Architect and design machine learning systems that provide value in close collaboration with business stakeholders from various domains;
  • Provide technical oversight and guidance in their implementation to a team of data scientists;
  • Take responsibility for maintaining these systems in production;
  • Take co-ownership in shaping the processes, standards and conventions of our organization to increase maintainability of solutions (e.g., via technical blueprints).

Qualifications

  • University degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related studies;
  • Proven track record of delivering business value with data products powered by machine learning;
  • Hands-on mentality with very good knowledge in Python;
  • Solid background in software-engineering best practices (e.g., design patterns, databases, code review, versioning, etc.);
  • Knowledge on deployment in Cloud environments (e.g., AWS or Azure);
  • Excellent communication skills;
  • Very good self-organization and autonomous working style;
  • Critical thinking, problem-solving mindset and the ability to quickly deep dive into new problems;
  • Experience with Agile project management;
  • Proficient English language skills (written / spoken).

Additional Information

  • Integration in a dynamic international work environment and team;
  • A wide range of application domains for ML&AI;
  • A state-of-the-art tech stack;
  • Flexible working model (hybrid);
  • Agile and collaborative workstyle;
  • Continuous opportunities for personal development and learning.

We are committed to fostering a workplace where everyone feels safe, respected, and valued. All kind of applications are welcome.

Ready to drive with Continental? Take the first step and fill in the online application.

Title: Senior/Lead Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description:
It's more than a job

In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagel‚Äôs global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.

‚Äé

Join a highly innovative and agile team of data scientists, data engineers, and software developers based in Hamburg, Porto, and Wroc≈Çaw to shape the next generation of data-driven logistics. As a Senior/Lead Data Scientist in the corporate AI team, you will design and implement world-class AI solutions for automation, decision-making, and optimization using the latest technologies. We are looking for a candidate who combines deep expertise in AI and software development with a passion for solving domain-specific challenges.

How you create impact


Design and implement our AI solutions using state-of-the-art AI technologies.
Shape the entire lifecycle of AI applications ‚Äì from ideation and exploration to specification, architectural design, prototyping, production implementation and enterprise-wide integration.
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to identify new opportunities.
Mentor more junior team members by sharing technical and domain expertise.
Uphold high engineering standards through code reviews and technical guidance.
Take an active role in project coordination and roadmap planning.


What we would like you to bring


Master‚Äôs or PhD degree in data science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, physics or a related field.
Two years of experience as a Senior Data Scientist or in an equivalent role.
Capability to envision and deliver end-to-end data-driven solutions.
Advanced hands-on experience in AI model development with strong proficiency in machine learning frameworks. Familiarity with large language models (LLMs), retrieval augmented generation (RAG) and agent-based systems is a plus.
Proficiency in Python with proven software architecture and development skills in enterprise environments.
Experience with data pipelines, workflow orchestration, APIs and databases. Practical experience with deployment, CI/CD pipelines and cloud platforms is a plus.
Experience mentoring team members and consulting with business stakeholders.
Excellent communication skills in spoken and written English paired with a collaborative mindset.


What's in it for you

Join Kuehne+Nagel‚Äôs IT Hub in Porto or Wroc≈Çaw and make a real impact on the digital transformation of our logistics enterprise. Here, you will find a hybrid work model, extensive health benefits, and a culture of continuous learning that ensures your career growth. You‚Äôll be surrounded by extraordinary and committed people, all dedicated to shaping the future of logistics. Even if you don‚Äôt tick every box, we encourage you to apply ‚Äî your unique perspective and experience could be exactly what we need. Be part of a team that values work-life balance, supports your personal well-being, and empowers you to contribute to something truly impactful.

Who we are

Logistics shapes everyday life - from the goods we consume to the healthcare we rely on. At Kuehne+Nagel, your work goes beyond logistics; it enables both ordinary and special moments in the lives of people around the world.

As a global leader with a strong heritage and a vision to move the world forward, we offer a safe, stable environment where your career can make a real difference. Whether we help deliver life-saving medicines, develop sustainable transportation solutions or support our local communities, your career will contribute to more than you can imagine.

We kindly advise that placement agencies refrain from submitting unsolicited profiles. Any submissions of candidates without prior signed agreement will be considered our property and no fees will be paid.

Title: Algorithms Engineer Trainee
HTML:
Sword Health is on a mission to free two billion people from pain.

With 67% of members achieving a pain-free life and a 70% reduction in surgery intent, at Sword, we are using AI Care to change lives, and save millions for our 25,000+ enterprise clients across three continents. Today, we hold the majority of industry patents, win 70% of competitive evaluations, and have raised more than $300 million from top venture firms like Founders Fund, Sapphire Ventures, General Catalyst, and Khosla Ventures.

Recognized as a Forbes Best Startup Employer in 2025, this award highlights our focus on being a destination for the best and brightest talent. Not only have we experienced unprecedented growth since our market debut in 2020, but we‚Äôve also created a remarkable mission and value-driven environment that is loved by our growing team. With a recent valuation of $4 billion, we are in a phase of hyper growth and expansion, and we‚Äôre looking for individuals with passion, commitment, and energy to help us scale our global impact.

Joining Sword means committing to a set of core values, chief amongst them to ‚Äúdo it for the patients‚Äù every day, and to always ‚Äúdeliver more than expected‚Äù on behalf of our members and clients.

This is an opportunity for you to make a significant difference on a massive scale as you work alongside 1000+ (and growing!) talented colleagues, spanning three continents. Your charge? To help us build a pain-free world, powered by AI, enhanced by people ‚Äî accessible to all.

The Sword Trainee Program is not about playing it safe, it‚Äôs where your career meets real-world impact. Over 12 months, you‚Äôll be part of a global team using technology to solve human problems at scale, and you‚Äôll do meaningful work from day one. You‚Äôll build and question, and be pushed to think deeper and move faster. Here, you won‚Äôt just apply what you learned in school ‚Äî you‚Äôll stretch it, test it, and turn it into solutions. If you‚Äôre looking for purpose, ownership, and a steep learning curve, this is your launchpad. And if you're ready to turn your potential into something that matters, we‚Äôre ready for you.

You can expect your work to be impactful in this role, as you contribute to the different products at Sword, from start to finish. This will demand your design and software engineering skills as well as a product-eye to perform data analysis and retrieve insights on the success of our strategies.

Our Algorithms team is a technically versatile Software Engineering team that thrives at solving complex and ambiguous problems. This is done by implementing (mostly) real-time algorithms that process different types of data. They are the team that builds the engine of our Digital Therapist, the ones behind our motion tracking, either with motion sensors or computer vision. They also contribute to the efforts of extracting insights and developing algorithms used in our wearable devices for Mind (mental health) and Move (movement health), as well as for Bloom (pelvic health).

What you‚Äôll be doing:

  • Design and implement algorithms and tooling to support our developments in several fronts, for example, to track pelvic floor movement tracking, sleep, activity and stress;
  • Perform data analysis to retrieve insights regarding how to improve existing algorithms and user experience;
  • Troubleshoot, debug and maintain documentation;
  • Contribute to the quality of the team‚Äôs output by developing and executing test plans and creating internal tools and scripts for automation and testing;
  • Communicate with product and clinical team to refine requirements and scope of work.


What you need to have:

  • Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Physics or Mathematics;
  • Ability to solve complex problems with software;
  • Solid knowledge of Python;
  • Good technical foundation (data science and related fields) but above all ability to learn about new technical topics;
  • Ability to visualize and interpret data of different types;
  • Critical thinking, self-direction, results-oriented mindset;
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders and within the team.


To ensure you feel good solving a big Human problem, we offer:

  • A stimulating, fast-paced environment with lots of room for creativity;
  • A start of a bright future at a promising high-tech startup company;
  • Access to our health and well-being program (digital therapist sessions);
  • Learning opportunities with tailored mentoring;
  • Remote or Hybrid work policy;
  • To get to know more about our Tech Stack, check here
  • Please note that this position does not offer relocation assistance. Candidates must possess a valid EU visa and be based in Portugal


SWORD Health, which includes SWORD Health, Inc. and Sword Health Professionals (consisting of Sword Health Care Providers, P.A., SWORD Health Care Providers of NJ, P.C., SWORD Health Care Physical Therapy Providers of CA, P.C.*) complies with applicable Federal and State civil rights laws and does not discriminate on the basis of Age, Ancestry, Color, Citizenship, Gender, Gender expression, Gender identity, Gender information, Marital status, Medical condition, National origin, Physical or mental disability, Pregnancy, Race, Religion, Caste, Sexual orientation, and Veteran status.

Title: Software Engineer I
Description:
At Talkdesk, we are courageous innovators focused on redefining the customer experience, making the impossible possible for companies globally. We champion an inclusive and diverse culture representative of the communities in which we live and serve. And, we give back to our community by volunteering our time, supporting non-profits, and minimizing our global footprint. Each day, thousands of employees, customers, and partners all over the world trust Talkdesk to deliver a better way to great experiences.




We are recognized as a cloud contact center leader by many of the most influential research organizations, including Gartner and Forrester. With $498 million in total funding, a valuation of more than $10 Billion, and a ranking of #16 on the Forbes Cloud 100 list, now is the time to be part of the Talkdesk legacy to help accelerate our success in a new decade of transformational growth.




At Talkdesk, we embrace FAST, our fundamental operating principles that define who we are as an organization. These principles drive us to make the impossible possible. FAST: Focus + Accountability + Speed = Talkdesker.





Focus: Focus time, energy and attention on what is most impactful for the business and thoughtful about how and when to partner with others.


Accountability: Hold self and others accountable to meet commitments and drive results. Accept responsibility for successes and failures.


Speed: Execute with agility and urgency. Act promptly, decisively, and without delay. Make good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.


Talkdesker: YOU!



The Software Engineer I is responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of software systems. The role requires an understanding of programming languages, software development frameworks, and database management. The successful candidate will work closely with a team of software developers, product managers, and quality assurance specialists to develop high-quality software solutions that meet client requirements.




Duties and Responsibilities:





Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify software requirements and design software solutions


Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code


Test and debug software applications


Troubleshoot software issues and provide timely resolutions


Maintain and update existing software systems


Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback


Provide technical support to end-users when required





Qualifications:





Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field


Proven experience in software development


Proficiency in programming languages such as Javascript, TypeScript and React


Knowledge in Java is a plus


Familiarity with software testing methodologies such as unit testing, integration testing, and end-to-end testing


Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills


Ability to work in a team environment


Strong communication skills





¬†




Additional Notes:
This position will follow a hybrid work model.




Work Environment and Physical Requirements:




Primarily office-environment work, extended periods of sitting or standing, computer-based work. Limited lifting, and equipment usage limited to computer-related equipment (keyboards, mouse, etc.)


The Talkdesk story hinges on empathy and acceptance. It is the shared goal among all Talkdeskers to empower a new kind of customer hero through our innovative software solution, and we firmly believe that the best path to success for our mission is inclusivity, diversity, and genuine acceptance. To that end, we will hire, promote, work along, cheer for, bond with, and warmly welcome into the Talkdesk family all persons without regard to ethnic and racial identity, indigenous heritage, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

Title: Frontend Developer
HTML:
Retail Consult is recruiting!


The impact of technology in retail is a game changer affecting every retailer from small, local shops to retail giants. Working at Retail Consult means being at the center of this industry in transformation. As specialists in technology solutions for retail, we provide solutions strategy, implementation, deployment, training, and support services for clients across a range of retail segments including fashion, grocery, pharmacy, do it yourself, telecommunications, and electronics. Work, train and learn with a growing team with over 300 people based in Portugal, the US, Germany, Brazil, Mexico, Chile and China, who are transforming the business of retailers across the globe.


We are currently seeking for Frontend Developers to join our growing delivery team in OPorto, Portugal.


What we are offering:


  • The opportunity to be part of a team responsible to Implement solutions in world-wide reference companies;
  • The opportunity to join a growing company with people passionate about their work in an international environment;
  • The opportunity to work with best-in-breed methodologies, tools and techniques;
  • Training and Mentoring/Talent Development programs;
  • Full package of Salary, perks, and benefits (Health Insurance, mobile allowance, and others);
  • Career Evolution, tailored for your profile and aspirations;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Extra days off;
  • Wellbeing program;
  • Partnerships with local businesses;


What you‚Äôll be doing:


  • Be part of a dedicated DevOps team responsible to design, develop and implement software solutions, with the role of Frontend Developer;
  • As part of DevOps team, ability to work with technical frameworks such as Oracle APEX, Oracle JET, Oracle PL/SQL, GitLab, Jira, Confluence, APIs, among others. If needed be, a training plan will be designed accordingly;
  • Interpret written business requirements and specification documents;
  • Perform coding in Oracle Apex and Oracle JET according to specifications and following stablished frameworks, workflows and best-practices;
  • Actively participate in different stages of a project lifecycle (design, development, quality assurance, implementation and stabilization);


What we are looking for:


  • 3+ years of proven experience in developing solutions using JavaScript, TypeScript, HTLM and CSS, according to standards defined and design guidelines;
  • Experience in playing the role of developer using Agile methodologies and DevOps Frameworks;
  • Ability to interpret written requirements and technical specification documents;
  • Experience working independently in a team-oriented, collaborative environment;
  • Degree in IT, Computer Science or Computer Engineering.
  • Proficiency in English is mandatory;


What would be a plus:

  • Experience in technical frameworks such as Oracle APEX and Oracle JET;
  • Certifications in the tools or technologies mentioned above.


If you think your profile matches our requirements and you are looking for an experience that offers opportunity, growth, balance, and a feeling of value, apply to this job submitting your CV at: www.retail-consult.com/en/work-with-us/ or jobs@retail-consult.com.


Retail Consult ‚Äì Transforming Retail with Passion

Title: Python Rockstar Developer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for bright Python Rockstar Developers to join our team




Join Critical TechWorks as a Python Developer and be part of our dynamic team driving the digital transformation in the automotive landscape for BMW Group's future driving machines. In this role, you'll be more than just a coder; you'll be a problem-solver, planner, and doer, bringing energy and star-quality to crafting high-quality, reliable software components for a variety of groundbreaking projects.




Framework Development: Engage in developing frameworks to facilitate integration testing for various communication protocols, ensuring seamless interactions within complex systems.
Automation and Testing: Craft and enhance automation frameworks for comprehensive testing, including hardware, software, and model-in-the-loop scenarios, to ensure robustness and reliability.
Scripting and Configuration: Regularly develop Python scripts for Linux environments, focusing on configuring the integration of a diverse range of tools within the CI/CD pipeline.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with other teams, including development, testing, and operations, to understand requirements and deliver effective solutions.
Quality and Reliability: Apply rigorous testing and quality assurance practices to maintain high standards in all software components, contributing to the overall reliability of the systems.
Innovative Solutions: Contribute to the development of innovative solutions in areas like framework development for integration testing, enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of testing processes.




This is a Rockstar Developer role, our take on the classic Software Developer.

Standing as the brick-and-mortar of Critical TechWorks, it plays a crucial role in designing, developing, building, testing, deploying, and maintaining our product. You can find out more - and check other Development vacancies - at this link.




Whatever you‚Äôre working on, here‚Äôs the lowdown on the technical skills you‚Äôre likely to have:

Proven experience developing in Python.
Experience developing scripting for Linux.
Experience with other scripting languages (preferably Shell).
Experience with version control tools (preferably Git).




CTW's Daily Toolkit




Apart from great technical skills, our environment is fast-paced and 100% agile, and prioritizes autonomy, teamwork, interaction and resilience. This means our Python Developers must also possess the following:

Embrace agile and its implementation frameworks namely Scrum, to make the most out of all its events and work to keep evolving a high-performing team.
Be available to be a cross-functional team member by using and developing new skills and enabling a fully responsible team able to cover the whole product lifecycle.
Use standard software engineering practices and tools like version control, IDEs, data dashboards, to manage and keep a systematic and organized development process.
Use state of the art DevOps quality practices and tools such as Continuous Integration /Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to build, analyse, perform automated testing and deployment processes, to ensure a streamlined and reliable development workflow.
Run and operate developed software inside and outside working hours if needed, to provide high quality software services (extra compensation will be applicable).
Be available to travel abroad for short periods, as required to support all the phases of the product development cycle when needed.
Have excellent English oral and written skills. German communication skills will be a plus.




Who we are




Critical TechWorks seeks a distinct and treasured corporate culture, that is very much our own. This means:

Growth and Innovation: Be a key player in shaping the future of mobility through innovative ideas.
Engineering Excellence: Immerse yourself in an environment valuing engineering process, where we create, innovate, lead, and make a tangible impact.
Autonomy and Collaboration: Thrive in a culture that blends autonomy with teamwork, contributing to groundbreaking developments.
Continuous Learning: Embrace constant skill enhancement in a dynamic workplace, where your contributions impact cutting-edge technology projects.




Join Critical TechWorks on our journey of innovation, excellence, and redefining the future of motion, one product at a time.




At Critical Techworks we are creating an inclusive culture that values our people‚Äôs different viewpoints and experiences, regardless of sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, ethnicity, religion, or disability.

Title: Junior Software Engineer
Description:
Hello! We're Teya.

Teya is a payment and software service provider, headquartered in London serving small, local businesses across Europe. Founded in 2019, we build easy to use, integrated tools that enable our members to accept payments and boost business performance.




At Teya we believe small, local businesses are the lifeblood of our communities.

We‚Äôre here because we don‚Äôt believe there‚Äôs a level playing field that gives small businesses with a fighting chance against the giants of the high street.

We‚Äôre here because we see banks and legacy service providers making things harder for them. We don‚Äôt think the best technology or the best service should be reserved for those with the biggest headquarters.

We‚Äôre here to fight for a future where small, local businesses can thrive, and to commit the same dedication they offer all of us.




Become a part of our story.

We‚Äôre looking for exceptional talent to join our mission. We offer a chance to create impact in a high-energy and connected culture, while benefiting from continuous learning opportunities, a supportive community which is proud to serve our mission, and comprehensive benefits.




Your Mission

You will work with a diverse team to help shape the future of our Engineering Department. You will be part of the whole feature development lifecycle, with direct access to a wealth of customer feedback.




You may use technologies such as Java, Kotlin, Golang, to write maintainable, performant, and high-quality code. We focus on continuous deployment and iterative delivery, to ensure that our code runs reliably on our infrastructure, allowing you to focus on delivering value to merchants in a fluid manner.




On a regular day as a Junior Software Engineer, you will:

Write clean and well-tested code to support business needs, while continuously learning best practices for coding.
Assist in building tools and integrating systems to enhance the efficiency of products across the business.
Collaborate closely with your team members and other departments, communicating effectively to contribute to the team‚Äôs success.
Be eager to learn and improve, while being empathetic and considerate in your interactions with others.
Gain experience in the full software development lifecycle, including participating in code reviews, learning source control management, understanding build processes, and supporting testing and release activities.




Your Story

We're seeking individuals with a positive attitude and a strong willingness to learn. While experience is a plus, what truly matters is your eagerness to grow, collaborate, and embrace fresh ideas. If you're passionate about development and ready to learn from a talented team, this role is for you!
Entry to 2 years of software development experience, including internships or personal projects.
Basic understanding of object-oriented programming principles and familiarity with data structures and algorithms.
Willingness to learn and apply software system design concepts, including object-oriented design.
Ability to write code to solve problems and a desire to improve your skills in analyzing time and space complexity.
Eagerness to learn and grow, with the ability to work effectively under supervision.

Nice To Have

Degree in computer sciences, programming, or a related field.
Previous experience in the Payments Industry, fintech, or Location and Business Recommendation Services platforms.
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Kubernetes, Helm).
Experience with current or specific frameworks, SDKs, APIs, and libraries relevant to Teya's technology stack (e.g. Laravel, Spring, Reactor).
Experience implementing authorisation Systems (example: RBAC, ABAC, SpiceDB).
Knowledge of cryptography or EMV.




The Perks

We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;
Health Insurance;
Meal Allowance;
25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);
Public Transportation Card;
Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;
Office snacks every day;
Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment.




Teya is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone regardless of race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, religion, or background can thrive and do their best work. We believe that a diverse team leads to better ideas, stronger outcomes, and a more supportive workplace for all.

If you require any reasonable adjustments at any stage of the recruitment process whether for interviews, assessments, or other parts of the application‚Äîwe encourage you to let us know. We are committed to ensuring that every candidate has a fair and accessible experience with us.

Hello! We're Teya.

Teya is a payment and software service provider, headquartered in London serving small, local businesses across Europe. Founded in 2019, we build easy to use, integrated tools that enable our members to accept payments and boost business performance.


At Teya we believe small, local businesses are the lifeblood of our communities.

We‚Äôre here because we don‚Äôt believe there‚Äôs a level playing field that gives small businesses with a fighting chance against the giants of the high street.

We‚Äôre here because we see banks and legacy service providers making things harder for them. We don‚Äôt think the best technology or the best service should be reserved for those with the biggest headquarters.

We‚Äôre here to fight for a future where small, local businesses can thrive, and to commit the same dedication they offer all of us.


Become a part of our story.

We‚Äôre looking for exceptional talent to join our mission. We offer a chance to create impact in a high-energy and connected culture, while benefiting from continuous learning opportunities, a supportive community which is proud to serve our mission, and comprehensive benefits.


Your Mission

You will work with a diverse team to help shape the future of our Engineering Department. You will be part of the whole feature development lifecycle, with direct access to a wealth of customer feedback.

  • Be eager to learn and improve, while being empathetic and considerate in your interactions with others.
  • Gain experience in the full software development lifecycle, including participating in code reviews, learning source control management, understanding build processes, and supporting testing and release activities.


Your Story

  • We're seeking individuals with a positive attitude and a strong willingness to learn. While experience is a plus, what truly matters is your eagerness to grow, collaborate, and embrace fresh ideas. If you're passionate about development and ready to learn from a talented team, this role is for you!
  • Entry to 2 years of software development experience, including internships or personal projects.
  • Basic understanding of object-oriented programming principles and familiarity with data structures and algorithms.
  • Willingness to learn and apply software system design concepts, including object-oriented design.
  • Ability to write code to solve problems and a desire to improve your skills in analyzing time and space complexity.
  • Eagerness to learn and grow, with the ability to work effectively under supervision.

Nice To Have

  • Degree in computer sciences, programming, or a related field.

  • Experience with current or specific frameworks, SDKs, APIs, and libraries relevant to Teya's technology stack (e.g. Laravel, Spring, Reactor).
  • Experience implementing authorisation Systems (example: RBAC, ABAC, SpiceDB).
  • Knowledge of cryptography or EMV.


The Perks

  • We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;
  • Health Insurance;
  • Meal Allowance;
  • 25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);
  • Public Transportation Card;
  • Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;

Title: Junior MES Solution Engineer
Description:
Critical Manufacturing is dedicated to empowering high-performance operations to make Industry 4.0 a reality with the most innovative, comprehensive, and modular MES software. We have a global presence, but our headquarters, and the main technical center, are in Porto (Maia), Portugal, where we develop a state-of-the-art solution for Semiconductor, Electronics, Medical Devices, and Industrial Equipment.

Recognized as a Leader by Gartner, we are part of ASMPT, the world's largest supplier of best-in-class equipment, and technological process partner for the electronics and semiconductor industries.

What you'll do:


Be the Go-To Problem Solver - Own and resolve incoming support requests, providing hands-on technical support for our product in high tech dynamic production environments
Collaborate Across Teams - Work closely with internal Engineering teams to investigate, troubleshoot, and resolve complex issues. You'll be the bridge that turns challenges into solutions
Drive Continuous Improvement - Evolve our support tools, processes, and infrastructure so we can scale smarter and respond faster. Your ideas and action will directly shape how we work
Keep the Customer in the Loop - communicate progress clearly and consistently, ensuring customers always know where things stand


Requirements

What you must have:


Knowledge in Programming and scripting languages (e.g. C#, JavaScript, PowerShell or Bash) - although primary responsibility is not programming, being able to interpret, troubleshoot and mitigate issues over existing code base is required
Knowledge in relational Databases - interpret a data model and being able to retrieve and analyze data
Excellent English skills - spoken and written
Time management, organization and prioritization
Attention to detail - thorough in work carried out
Great interpersonal and communication skills - working together to meet deadlines
Initiative - seeking continuous improvement and implementing best practice in technology environment


What we consider a plus (not mandatory):


Knowledge with SQL Server
Knowledge of Kubernetes or other container platforms




Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are a source of commitment and innovation

At Critical Manufacturing, we welcome and encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of disabilities, diverse abilities, identities, or experiences. Our commitment is to create an inclusive environment where everyone has equal opportunities to succeed and thrive.

If you need accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know - we're happy to support you.
