Title: Internal AI Solutions Trainee
HTML:
Sword Health is on a mission to free two billion people from pain.

With 67% of members achieving a pain-free life and a 70% reduction in surgery intent, at Sword, we are using AI Care to change lives, and save millions for our 25,000+ enterprise clients across three continents. Today, we hold the majority of industry patents, win 70% of competitive evaluations, and have raised more than $300 million from top venture firms like Founders Fund, Sapphire Ventures, General Catalyst, and Khosla Ventures.

Recognized as a Forbes Best Startup Employer in 2025, this award highlights our focus on being a destination for the best and brightest talent. Not only have we experienced unprecedented growth since our market debut in 2020, but we‚Äôve also created a remarkable mission and value-driven environment that is loved by our growing team. With a recent valuation of $4 billion, we are in a phase of hyper growth and expansion, and we‚Äôre looking for individuals with passion, commitment, and energy to help us scale our global impact.

Joining Sword means committing to a set of core values, chief amongst them to ‚Äúdo it for the patients‚Äù every day, and to always ‚Äúdeliver more than expected‚Äù on behalf of our members and clients.

This is an opportunity for you to make a significant difference on a massive scale as you work alongside 1000+ (and growing!) talented colleagues, spanning three continents. Your charge? To help us build a pain-free world, powered by AI, enhanced by people ‚Äî accessible to all.

The Sword Trainee Program is not about playing it safe, it‚Äôs where your career meets real-world impact. Over 12 months, you‚Äôll be part of a global team using technology to solve human problems at scale, and you‚Äôll do meaningful work from day one. You‚Äôll build and question, and be pushed to think deeper and move faster. Here, you won‚Äôt just apply what you learned in school ‚Äî you‚Äôll stretch it, test it, and turn it into solutions. If you‚Äôre looking for purpose, ownership, and a steep learning curve, this is your launchpad. And if you're ready to turn your potential into something that matters, we‚Äôre ready for you.

As a Trainee in the Internal AI Solutions team, you‚Äôll contribute to the design and implementation of internal tools powered by Generative AI ‚Äî directly impacting teams like Finance, Commercial, and Talent. You'll work closely with engineers and stakeholders to streamline workflows and help build a more efficient company from within.

The Internal AI Solutions Team leads the transformation of Sword Health‚Äôs internal operations through Generative AI. We‚Äôre a small, agile group that works cross-functionally to understand how teams operate and how we can help them do it better and faster using AI. From Slack bots to custom dashboards and workflow assistants, we implement innovative solutions that enhance productivity, save time, and scale impact across the company.

What you‚Äôll be doing:

  • Assist in the development and integration of AI-powered tools for internal teams;
  • Help build user-facing features and back-end logic using technologies like React, Node.js, and Python;
  • Participate in the deployment of pipelines using cloud services like AWS or Azure;
  • Work with Large Language Models (LLMs) to automate manual processes and enhance internal support systems;
  • Collaborate with the Internal AI team and other engineers on identifying opportunities and delivering impactful solutions


What you need to have:

  • Background in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field;
  • Knowledge of JavaScript or Python;
  • Familiarity with REST APIs and basic web development principles;
  • Willingness to learn about Large Language Models and cloud-based AI tools;
  • Interest in problem-solving and improving internal tools and workflows


What we would love to see:

  • Experience with SQL or database querying;
  • Exposure to AI or data-related projects (academic or personal);
  • Knowledge of tools like LangChain, Pinecone, or vector databases;
  • Curiosity about Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG);
  • Initiative to take ownership of small projects and iterate on user feedback


To ensure you feel good solving a big Human problem, we offer:

  • A stimulating, fast-paced environment with lots of room for creativity;
  • A start of a bright future at a promising high-tech startup company;
  • Access to our health and well-being program (digital therapist sessions);
  • Learning opportunities with tailored mentoring
  • Remote or Hybrid work policy.
  • To get to know more about our Tech Stack, check here
  • Please note that this position does not offer relocation assistance. Candidates must possess a valid EU visa and be based in Portugal


SWORD Health, which includes SWORD Health, Inc. and Sword Health Professionals (consisting of Sword Health Care Providers, P.A., SWORD Health Care Providers of NJ, P.C., SWORD Health Care Physical Therapy Providers of CA, P.C.*) complies with applicable Federal and State civil rights laws and does not discriminate on the basis of Age, Ancestry, Color, Citizenship, Gender, Gender expression, Gender identity, Gender information, Marital status, Medical condition, National origin, Physical or mental disability, Pregnancy, Race, Religion, Caste, Sexual orientation, and Veteran status.

Title: RPA Analyst/Developer - Oporto
Description:
About the Company




Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.




Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.




About the Role




We are looking for an RPA Analyst/Developer profile for the ITTF AF PA Intelligence Automation Squad - Scale & Quality (Porto)




Main Tasks:




Responsible for the design, development, testing and implementation of RPA robot's which will interact with multiple third-party applications




Continuous improvement of software development best practices




Ensure reliability and quality on the deliverables




Test, monitor and evaluate solutions




Collect, analyze the needs expressed by the business and associated functional documentation




Technical Skills:




RPA development experience (+2 years) with one of the market leading RPA platforms: Blue Prism (highly recommendable), Automation Anywhere, UIPath




Involvement in AI related projects (NLG, NLP, OCR, Machine Learning)




Previous experience as analyst in RPA projects is a strong plus




Previous Experience in software development




Working knowledge of Agile methodologies




Language Skills:




Good level in English is required (speaking, reading, and writing)




Soft Skills:




High level of analysis and problem-solving capability




Organization, process, and client focus oriented skills




Ability to clear communicate and report project status to the management




Pro-active behavior regarding the ability to work in a fast changing and demanding environment




Strong interpersonal and communication (spoken and written) skills

Title: English Second Language (ESL) Tutor
Description:
The ESL Tutor is responsible for delivering high-quality English language instruction to Mandarin-speaking students. This role involves planning and conducting lessons that enhance students‚Äô proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing. The tutor will tailor teaching methods to address the specific challenges faced by Mandarin speakers and support students in achieving their language learning goals.




ÔªøRoles

Teach English language skills: speaking, listening, reading, and writing.
Plan and deliver engaging lessons tailored for Mandarin speakers.
Help students improve pronunciation, vocabulary, and grammar.
Explain English culture and customs to aid understanding.
Assess student progress and provide regular feedback.
Encourage students to speak and participate actively.
Adapt teaching methods to address common challenges faced by Mandarin speakers.
Maintain clear communication with students and, if applicable, parents.
Prepare and use teaching materials and resources effectively.




Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Education, English, or related field (or equivalent).
TESOL, TEFL, CELTA, or ESL teaching certification preferred.
Experience teaching English to non-native speakers, especially Mandarin-speaking students, is an advantage.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Patience and adaptability in teaching diverse learners.
Ability to create engaging and interactive lessons.

Title: AVP - Operations and Maintenance Solar
Description:
Job ID: 2793

Location: Cayanga

Company: PV Sinag Power Inc.

Department: -

Employment Type: Probationary

Work Arrangement: Hybrid

This position is responsible for leading and managing the generation assets of the plants to maximize revenue based on available irradiance, reduce operating costs, minimize generation losses and maintenance expenses, and maintain industry-standard or higher plant availability and reliability factors.


Directs and orchestrates operations and maintenance of all the plants in the grid within company policies and procedures.


PLANT OPERATIONS


Strategize on how the grids can attain productivity, plant availability, efficiency, reliability, profitability, and resource requirements for Operations and Maintenance to support the company's strategic directions
Ensures that the plants generate to the maximum level allowed by the available irradiance, without wastage, to maximize energy production and, hence, the revenue stream by reviewing and monitoring operations reports and KPIs from Team Leaders.
Ensures that operating procedures and processes are fully documented with manuals, instructions, and procedures to ensure generation assets' safe, repeatable, and managed operation.
Ensures that the plants are operated, dispatched, and logged following EPSA, NGCP, and customer requirements.


MAINTENANCE MANAGEMENT


Develops and recommends maintenance programs that achieve plant objectives, allow full control of plant performance, and ensure plant availability and reliability to meet the business's needs.
Manages the proper implementation of maintenance programs by ensuring the maximum usage of the Maintenance Management Software tool (CMMS) and expanding its usage to operations and other technical services. Guides Grid Managers in analyzing the output of CMMS to achieve the desired efficiency and safety of all the generating units. Reviews maintenance schedules for significant equipment such as transformers, MV stations, inverters, and substations to ensure there is enough time to take corrective or preventive measures or source service providers in case unfavorable conditions are detected.
Ensures that scheduled equipment tests are conducted, test results are reviewed, trends are established, and values are compared to standard allowable values.


ASSET MANAGEMENT


Performs the duty of Chief Asset Manager and reports to AM-Asset Owner
Accountable for implementing a Solar-specific Asset Management Plan
Ensures assets are managed following design performance & specifications, including legal, environmental, and safety requirements Ensures implementation of asset condition assessment.
Ensures the conduct of asset prioritization and criticality for grids specific asset strategies
Ensures the development and implementation of grid specific asset strategies.
Ensures development of grid-specific spares management system in coordination with SCM
Reviews root-cause analysis of asset/s and asset system/s failures or incidents; identifies lessons learned, including recommendations to the Technical Services Department and AM Committee
Prepares budgetary requirements per Finance's budgeting process.


INVENTORY, SUPPLY AND LOGISTICS


Ensures availability and accessibility of appropriate resources, tools, equipment, transportation, and services to ensure sustained optimized operations and maintenance of the plant
Periodically reviews current plant spare parts inventories and recommends procurement to minimize generation losses in planned or corrective maintenance cases.


PEOPLE MANAGEMENT


Develops and enhances workforce maintenance and operations capability and qualifications to ensure sustainability and development of the maintenance and operations functions.
Identifies reviews and recommends staff training needs to enhance skills, abilities, knowledge/awareness, and teamwork.
Evaluates the performance and contributions of direct reports based on targets.


RISK MANAGEMENT


Develops and maintains emergency response and management plans to ensure risks are managed and mitigated
Ensures all accidents are thoroughly investigated, the root causes determined, and corrective actions taken to prevent recurrence.


FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT


Reviews and recommends operations plans, annual budget, and projections for the succeeding year based on forecast, including preparation and monitoring of CAPEX.
Monitors monthly expenditures for Operations and Maintenance and provides variance explanations to Management as needed.


IMPROVEMENT


Ensures that the principles of quality management are inculcated into the operation to drive continuous improvement in all aspects of operations and maintenance by encouraging Quality Improvement Projects from Team Leaders
Ensures that internal audits are conducted periodically on operations and maintenance procedures, including safety aspects, non-conformance reports are documented, and corrective measures are implemented as necessary.


COMMUNITY AND EXTERNAL RELATIONS


Assists and participates in Community Relations Programs approved by Management to maintain and improve relationships with host community residents and local government unit officials


COMPLIANCE MONITORING TO GOVERNMENT REGULATORY


Ensures compliance of the plants to the DOE, ERC, Grid Code, EPIRA Law, ERB, NGCP, PSALM, and WESM requirements, as with ECC, EPSA, and all MOA obligations
Helps ensure that all necessary permits and licenses for an unhampered operation of the plants are secured and complied with


Minimum Qualifications


Must be a licensed engineer, preferably in Electrical, Electronics or Civil
With at least 10 years of professional experience in Solar Power Plant and/or BESS operations
With at least 7 years of leadership experience in a supervisory capacity within a power generation facility
With involvement in at least one enterprise-wide project or a minimum of three function-related projects
Preferably with a postgraduate diploma or master‚Äôs degree relevant to the field

  • Ensures that internal audits are conducted periodically on operations and maintenance procedures, including safety aspects, non-conformance reports are documented, and corrective measures are implemented as necessary.

COMMUNITY AND EXTERNAL RELATIONS

  • Assists and participates in Community Relations Programs approved by Management to maintain and improve relationships with host community residents and local government unit officials

COMPLIANCE MONITORING TO GOVERNMENT REGULATORY

  • Ensures compliance of the plants to the DOE, ERC, Grid Code, EPIRA Law, ERB, NGCP, PSALM, and WESM requirements, as with ECC, EPSA, and all MOA obligations
  • Helps ensure that all necessary permits and licenses for an unhampered operation of the plants are secured and complied with

Minimum Qualifications

  • Must be a licensed engineer, preferably in Electrical, Electronics or Civil
  • With at least 10 years of professional experience in Solar Power Plant and/or BESS operations
  • With at least 7 years of leadership experience in a supervisory capacity within a power generation facility
  • With involvement in at least one enterprise-wide project or a minimum of three function-related projects
  • Preferably with a postgraduate diploma or master‚Äôs degree relevant to the field

Title: Field Commercial Executive - Mangaldan
Description:
Be a part of a revolutionary change

Sales and Marketing at PMI feels like building a new business ‚Äì but with the accumulated expertise of a global brand behind you. Bring us your curiosity and capacity to engage people and you can be part of the digital, omni-channel team that‚Äôs driving our huge commercial transformation.

Accountabilities: Your day to day tasks


Negotiate, sell and distribute PMFTC portfolio in covered outlets to achieve business objectives.
Execute targeted and purposeful commercial activities to drive and achieve Commercial KPIs such as volume, distribution and collection targets.
Understand Retail & LAS profiles to have a holistic view of their customer journey, recommend and implement demand generation initiatives/programs that are fit for the business.
Provide and maintain quality customer service and develop effective relationships at retail in order to position PMFTC as preferred business partner and maintain competitive advantage.
Coordinate with their Business Building partners to identify critical areas for promoter deployment and help improve awareness, and trial of our brands
Educate consumers In selecting the right PMFTC products by emphasizing the product benefits and correct usage; builds brand loyalty through sampling as needed and in accordance to PMI Marketing Guidelines.
Checks and monitors daily cash collection and AR of POS to ensure adherence to credit policies; prevent fraud, bad debts and over aging
Ensures demonstration of strong values, integrity and ethics through actions, words, behavior and performance while in service, and help create positive work environment


Skill And Competencies


High School graduate (College graduate, preferred)
Strong Interpersonal skills and are knowledgeable in negotiation and consultative selling
Field sales exposure is an advantage
With relevant sales/marketing projects and initiatives
Should be comfortable to ride a panel truck / L300 (closed van)


Work Location: Mangaldan Sales Office ‚Äì should be amenable to be assigned to do field work in areas covered by Mangaldan Sales office

Work Schedule: Mondays to Saturdays, no fixed schedule and can start as early as 4:30 AM

Our above market practice on Compensation & Benefits provide you with:


Guaranteed 14th month pay
HMO coverage for you and your qualified dependents
PHP 10,000 annual medical reimbursement
Monthly incentives up to 20,000
Retirement Plan
Leave Conversion


At PMI, we are fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. We see diversity as our greatest strength and are committed to building an inclusive culture and workplace reflective of the world‚Äôs diversity. Our focus is on creating an environment where our employees from across the globe can be their true selves at work, contribute their best, support each other, and drive the innovation and consumer-centricity needed to help us to achieve our vision of a smoke-free future.

With huge change, comes huge opportunity. So, wherever you join us, you‚Äôll enjoy the freedom to dream up and deliver better, brighter solutions and the space to move your career forward in endlessly different directions.

Title: SME Account Officer - Urdaneta
Description:
Your Role

The SME Account Officer markets the bank products and identifies every business opportunity from each referred client and designs package that will ensure optimum profitability of the account and promotes further business relationship.




Your Impact

Generated portfolio must be of good quality and income generating
Scouts for potential clients from branch referrals, performs client calls and project visits
Identifies every business opportunity from each referred client and designs package that will ensure optimum profitability of the account and promotes further business relationship
Conducts client visits alone or jointly with supervisor or proposing Branch Manager and/or phones clients in accordance with bank standards
Requests the property appraisal and/or credit investigation of the potential client and checks the appraisal and/or credit investigation reports prepared by CAS.
Ensures that overall creditworthiness of account is established before presentation to the approving body.
Prepares Application for Accommodation report in coordination with RSCC and LAD.
Packages credit proposals in accordance with the guidelines of the bank, BSP and other regulatory agencies.




Your Profile

Experience in handling SME Accounts for at least 1 year
Proficient in Windows based programs (Word, Excel, Power point)
Able to travel frequently and for extended period to provincial areas

Title: Branch Cashier - Tarlac Camiling
Description:
The Branch Cashier is responsible for the administration and control of all technical aspects of branch cash operations including physical custody of monies, securities, and collateral. Provides support in the marketing aspects of the branch thru cross selling of bank products and services and ensuring that staff members have full understanding of the same to meet the demands of clients and achieve the targets set for the branch. Participates in credit evaluation of loan application and renewals.

Title: Branch Head (Dagupan-Perez)
Description:
The Branch Head provides strategic direction and operational management support to branch employees by assuming overall accountability for service and product delivery, establishing and maintaining customer relationships, implementing an effective sales management system, ensuring risk assessment compliance, maintaining branch upkeep/orderliness and communicating/instituting/monitoring compliance to company policies and control procedures to achieve the unit‚Äôs business plans and corporate targets set by Top Management.




Professional Experience:

3-5 years job experience in Branch Operations, Sales and Marketing of Bank Products and Services.




Knowledge and Skills Required:

Proficient in MS Word, Excel and Powerpoint.
Should have knowledge in branch operations and policies, labor laws, internal policies, audit system, BSP / other agencies‚Äô policies, administrative disciplinary rules and procedures.
Must possess strong marketing, communication and analytical skills; has keen attention to details; has the ability for critical thinking and very good people management skills. Should have proactive orientation.

Title: Senior Technical Program Manager (Federal Programs)
Description:
About Beacon AI

Beacon AI is developing AI pilot assistant technology to transform aviation, flight safety, operational efficiency, and pilot capabilities. We are on a mission to leverage the power of artificial intelligence and advanced data analytics to revolutionize the aviation industry. Join us to be at the cutting edge of technological innovation for the second century of aviation.

Role Overview

We‚Äôre hiring a Technical Program Manager (Federal Programs) to lead critical defense programs, including our work with Special Operations and Air Force communities. This person will drive program execution, support fielding and validation of new aviation technologies, and be a trusted interface between users, engineers, customers, and acquisition teams.

You'll be hands-on with efforts across several contracts and customers, supporting integrations, advanced pilot assistance feature development, and operational software deployments across defense aviation platforms.

What You‚Äôll Do


Lead cross-functional program execution for defense customers, ensuring technical milestones are delivered on time and aligned to mission needs.
Interface with DoD stakeholders (PEOs, TPOCs, acquisition offices, pilots) to manage schedules, updates, deliverables, and feedback loops.
Translate operational needs into technical requirements, particularly for aircraft operations, debrief, mission planning, and pilot assistance.
Coordinate user engagements and flight demonstrations, including simulator events and aircraft integration.
Support proposal development, responses to government solicitations, and long-term roadmap planning.
Ensure contract compliance and timely delivery of CDRLs, milestone demos, technical reports, and training documentation.
Work closely with Beacon‚Äôs engineering, product, and operations teams to keep programs user-focused and technically executable.


What Will Make You Successful


Former DoD pilot or aircrew, ideally with SOF, AFSOC, tactical, or mobility aviation experience.
Experience supporting or working within DoD acquisition offices (e.g., PEO Fixed Wing, AFLCMC).
Familiarity with requirements generation, validation, and transition planning.
Track record of delivering technology programs involving multiple stakeholders and operational users.
Strong skills in stakeholder management, briefings, and written communications.
Comfort navigating the engineering side (with software and hardware teams) and the government side (with end users and contracting officers).
Experience contributing to DoD proposals (writing, grading, reviewing).
Eligible for a DoD security clearance
Willingness to travel 10‚Äì15% to military installations, flight demonstrations, and stakeholder meetings


Bonus Points


Experience with flight test operations or military flight releases.
Familiarity with aircraft modifications, including avionics integration and equipment installation.
Experience with Electronic Flight Bag (EFB) development or deployment.
Understanding aircraft interface devices, aircraft databuses (e.g. ARINC 717/429, or MIL-STD-1553B).
Flight Data Monitoring (FDM) or (Military) Flight Operations Quality Assurance (MFOQA/FOQA) program management.
Exposure to cybersecurity, hazard analysis, or certification processes in aviation or defense settings.


Join Beacon AI to be at the forefront of innovation, driving the transformation of aviation technology and making a tangible impact on the future of flight.

This is a hybrid role and requires working from our San Carlos, CA office at least three days a week, with the option to work remotely the remaining days.

Perks & Benefits For Full-Time Employees


Comprehensive Healthcare Coverage: Enjoy peace of mind with our generous health benefits, with 80% of medical costs covered by the company for the employee and 25% for their dependents.
Paid Time Off: Recharge and relax with 3 weeks of paid vacation, in addition to 14 company-paid holidays each year.
Connectivity Stipend: Stay connected with our cell phone benefit, ensuring you have the tools you need to excel in your role.
Health and Wellness Allowance: Use this towards a gym membership or subscription to a meditation app, empowering you to prioritize self-care and maintain a healthy lifestyle.
Financial Planning: Prepare for the future with our 401(k) program. While we currently do not offer matching, we are committed to enhancing this benefit in the future.


For Nearly All Roles, The Following May Apply

At this time, due to United States Department of State regulations, we are only able to hire U.S. Persons. A U.S. Person is a lawful permanent resident (U.S. citizen, legal immigrant with a 'Green Card', or a protected individual who has been granted permanent asylum or refugee status.) These aerospace restrictions mean that we are unable to provide visa sponsorship or consider candidates who require visa transfers. Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future. All work must be performed in the United States.

Beacon AI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, employer complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Employer expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

Title: BANK TELLER (PANGASINAN)
Description:
The Customer Sales and Service Associate (CSSA) provides competent, caring, fast and accurate service to client's banking needs in line with the Bank's overall objective of service excellence.

Responsibilities


Processing over-the-counter transactions such as cash and check deposits, withdrawals, encashment, payments and miscellaneous transactions
Assisting UNIPRO for certain activities such as scanning, filing of signature cards and other bank documents
Reviewing all check transactions and verifying authenticity of all notes received
Cross-selling to existing clients of the branch
Referring transacting clients who have queries or are interested in other bank products
Continuously providing a WOW Customer Experience to all transacting clients
Performing other functions that may be assigned from time to time


Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in any field, preferably business-related
No work experience required but experience in customer service is an advantage
Good communication skills and interpersonal skills
High level of initiative and innovation
Ability to work well with people from various socio-economic classes
Willing to be assigned and rotated to any branch within the area
